title: Junior Embedded Developer (RTOS/C++)
description:
We are looking for a motivated Junior Embedded Developer eager to grow their career in embedded systems. In this role, you will work on key embedded software projects, collaborating with senior engineers to build, test, and optimize software solutions. This is a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience with Rust, C++, and real-time systems.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Support the development of embedded software in Rust and C++.
* Assist with testing on both hosts and target devices.
* Participate in setting up and improving CI/CD pipelines.
* Collaborate on test and production platforms to ensure reliability.
* Learn and support code reviews, debugging, and schematic reading where applicable.



  





**Requirements** 



* 1-3 years of experience in embedded software development.
* Familiarity with Rust, C++, and RTOS systems.
* Basic understanding of software testing and debugging in embedded environments.
* Desire to learn and improve technical skills in embedded systems.
* Basic knowledge of electrical schematics and design (bonus).
* Team-oriented with strong communication skills.



  





**About us** 




 At TERNA, innovation is at the core of everything we do. Our flagship product is an Android application assisting individual operators and machines to work more productively through 2D, to sophisticated GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) based 3D solutions elevating construction to the next level and connecting entire fleets in real time.
 



 What sets us apart is our commitment to excellence in every aspect of what we do. We’ve developed our own Inertial Measurement Units (IMUs) from scratch, handling everything from electrical design to firmware development, testing, calibration, and mechanical design in-house. Our combined software and hardware solutions offer an impressive accuracy and, unparalleled precision and reliability.
 



  





 As we continue to grow in a rapidly expanding global market, we’re looking for passionate individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments and are eager to make a meaningful impact.
 



 Join us on this exciting journey as we push the boundaries of innovation and drive our continued path towards the digitalized and resourceful work site.
 



  





 What we offer:
 


* Fast-paced environment with rapid growth and expansion opportunities where every day brings new challenges and learning experiences.
* High-energy team driving towards ambitious goals.
* Hybrid workspace, flexibility to work from home or office, supports work-life balance.
* Core hours and flex time, 9am-3pm core hours and flexibility for personalized schedules.
* “Freaky Fridays”, monthly passion project days, promotes innovation and personal growth.
* Training and development, access to courses and training, fosters continuous learning and personal growth.
* Health and wellness benefits, financial support for maintaining a healthy and active lifestyle for physical well-being.
* ITP Tjänstepension, supplementary pension plan for retirement savings.

title: Java Developer (R-17335)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet combines global data and local expertise to help clients make smarter decisions. With 6,000+ people in 31 countries, we are a team of diverse thinkers and problem solvers who all share a common curiosity: to find new ways to turn data into value. If you share this curiosity and want to be part of a future-ready company, come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

**The role**
 We are looking for an experienced Java Developer to join our team in Sweden. We maintain and develop several business-critical applications built on Java, .NET, and SQL Server. As we move toward a unified, modern architecture in Java and AWS, we need a help to drive technical improvements, support the team, and promote best practices in software development and agile collaboration.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Hands-On Development: Design, build, and refactor systems into containerized microservices running in cloud.
* Handle critical maintenance & support in both modern and legacy: Handle incidents in production systems with technical investigations and solutions.
* Drive Modernization: Contribute to the strategy and execution of transforming legacy applications into modern cloud solutions.
* Support the Team: Share knowledge, promote modern software development practices, and encourage team collaboration.
* Advocate for Best Practices: Implement clean code principles, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker).


**Skills**
* Technical Expertise:
* Around 5 years of experience with Java and microservices development.
* Exposure to legacy systems (e.g., .NET and relational databases like SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB).
* Proficiency with Docker and experience building containerized applications.
* Familiarity with Spring Boot framework and AWS cloud services.
* Well-oriented and comfortable working on Linux on-prem servers.
* Team and Collaboration:
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment, sharing knowledge and supporting colleagues.
* Experience working with agile processes and a collaborative mindset.
* Mindset:
* Passion for system modernization, solving technical challenges and improving processes.
* Willingness to bridge the gap between legacy systems and modern software solutions.
* Fluent in both English and Swedish language


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


**New Office Location**
 Our office is currently located in Solna, however we are very excited to be moving to a beautiful new location in central Stockholm at the end of 2025. Our future address will be Fleminggatan 14 in Kungsholmen, just a short walk from Stockholm Central Station.
   

  

***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: ETL Developer
ETL Developer
Back End Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Backend Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about building innovative, scalable solutions
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment? Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



  





 We are looking for multiple profiles, both fluent in Swedish, and non-Swedish speaking.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Backend Developer** 




 Your role as a Backend Developer and a consultant at Valtech will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
 



 Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
 



 In addition, you will:
 


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and mantain innovative solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Work with modern development practices, including CI/CD, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and automated testing
* Help maintain system documentation and participate in project reviews
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle



  





**You and the role** 




 You are a developer at mid-to-senior level with at least 5 years of experience in the field of backend-end development. As a person, you are flexible and adaptable to changes, and can see yourself thriving in working in a highly innovative fast-paced start-up like environment.
 



  





**We would love if you have** 



* A relevant technical education or equivalent level of experience within the following areas or similar: computer science, software engineering, application development, backend engineering
* At least 5 years of professional experience in backend development, ideally in an agile project environment
* Preferable professional working experience from IT consultancy, digital agency, start-up or similar fast-paced working environment
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week



  





**Your technical skills should include:** 



* Solid knowledge of both Java and .NET
* Experience working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Ideally, you are comfortable working with containerized solutions (Kubernetes, Docker)
* Any experience or interest to work with Kotlin will be considered as a plus but is not required for this role
* Experience working in agile working environment with tools like Jira and Confluence



  





**What you can expect from us** 




 Valtech will always be recognized not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing. We have an inclusive culture where we share our thoughts and our knowledge, we have fun together, and we care about each other. Our core values, Share, Care, Dare defines our culture and makes Valtech a workplace where you thrive and develop.
 



  





**Join Valtech** 




 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.
 



  





**Does it excite you to join Valtech on this journey? And would you like to become our next Backend Developer?** 




  





**Then apply today** 
 . We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Full Stack Developer & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**Note: This Opportunity Does Not Offer Employment, but rather an opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished full-stack software developer with a demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions. Your exceptional programming skills and experience in building complex applications position you to tackle significant challenges within the tech industry. You possess a strong problem-solving aptitude and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge technologies. Driven to make a real impact, you're eager to leverage your expertise in building disruptive tech ventures.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we’re looking for someone who:** 



* Having the autonomy to develop sophisticated software solutions to address real-world challenges, merging ingenuity with functionality.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of breaking down complex issues and bringing structure into business cases
* Providing leadership, whether it’s directing a development team or managing comprehensive product delivery.
* You have an idea that you believe can solve a problem you are deeply interested in. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Antler Success Stories** 




 Several companies built through the Antler program have received pre-seed investment and have gone on to secure significant funding rounds. Here are just a few examples:
 


* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Senior Software Engineer – Spatial Computing & Sensor Automation
description:
We also accept consultants and full time positions for this job opening.
 




  





**Responsibilities (short term)** 



* Work with quaternions, rotation matrices, and advanced mathematical models to improve accuracy in digital representations of the environment.
* Design and implement multiple ways of calibrating new types of machines, attachments and tools.
* Implement algorithms that process IMU, GNSS and other sensors data to accurately represent different types and layouts of machines.
* Optimize performance for real-time applications, ensuring accuracy, speed, and efficiency.
* Document and communicate complex mathematical and engineering concepts clearly to cross-functional teams.
* Collaborate with frontend, backend and embedded teams to enhance environmental perception and interaction.



  





**Responsibilities (long term)** 



* Implement full and partial automations of different machines, such as an excavator’s tilt rotator and a dozer’s blade.
* Create algorithms that track machine usage and wear over time, using sensor data and find patterns in machine behavior.
* Integrate and fuse data from various sensors, including IMUs, LiDAR, depth cameras, drones, surveying and GNSS, to build reliable spatial models
* Design and implement scalable solutions for mapping real-world environments to digital constructs for real-time and offline use cases.
* Synchronize data across multiple devices and cloud solutions in real time.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, Robotics, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience working with spatial computing, mathematical modeling, and sensor integration.
* Strong understanding of quaternions, rotation matrices, and 3D transformations.
* Experience with point cloud processing techniques and tools.
* Proficiency in C++, Python, or similar languages for high-performance computing and numerical analysis.
* Hands-on experience with sensor technologies such as IMUs, LiDAR, cameras, and GNSS.
* Familiarity with SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) and real-time positioning algorithms.
* Experience with 3D engines (Unity, Unreal) or GIS systems is a plus.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work on complex technical challenges.



  





**Preferred Qualifications** 



* Background in robotics, automation, or autonomous systems.
* Experience with machine learning techniques for sensor data processing.
* Understanding of real-time optimization for embedded or high-performance computing systems.
* Experience with machine control systems.
* Experience with point clouds or voxels to generate accurate topographic maps.



  





**About TERNA** 





 At TERNA, innovation is at the core of everything we do. Our flagship product is an Android application assisting individual operators and machines to work more productively through 2D, to sophisticated GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) based 3D solutions elevating construction to the next level and connecting entire fleets in real time.
 





 What sets us apart is our commitment to excellence in every aspect of what we do. We’ve developed our own Inertial Measurement Units (IMUs) from scratch, handling everything from electrical design to firmware development, testing, calibration, and mechanical design in-house. Our combined software and hardware solutions offer an impressive accuracy and, unparalleled precision and reliability.
 




  






 As we continue to grow in a rapidly expanding global market, we’re looking for passionate individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments and are eager to make a meaningful impact.
 





 Join us on this exciting journey as we push the boundaries of innovation and drive our continued path towards the digitalized and resourceful work site.
 




  





**What we offer** 



* Fast-paced environment with rapid growth and expansion opportunities where every day brings new challenges and learning experiences.
* High-energy team driving towards ambitious goals.
* Hybrid workspace, flexibility to work from home or office, supports work-life balance.
* Core hours and flex time, 9am-3pm core hours and flexibility for personalized schedules.
* “Freaky Fridays”, monthly passion project days, promotes innovation and personal growth.
* Training and development, access to courses and training, fosters continuous learning and personal growth.
* Health and wellness benefits, financial support for maintaining a healthy and active lifestyle for physical well-being.
* ITP Tjänstepension, supplementary pension plan for retirement savings.



  





 If you’re passionate about advanced mathematics, real-world positioning and making a real impact on the world, we’d love to hear from you!

 ETL Developer, ETL Engineer, FME (essential), FME Flow Management, SQL, TransactSQL, Data Modelling, Data Warehousing, SDLC - Agile/ Waterfall.

title: Senior Embedded Developer (C++, RTOS)
description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Embedded Developer with expertise in Rust, C++, and Real-Time Operating Systems (RTOS). You will play a critical role in the design and development of embedded software solutions, collaborating across teams to ensure high-quality delivery and performance. Your work will also include mentoring junior engineers, setting technical direction, and enhancing production infrastructure.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Lead the design, development, and implementation of embedded software in Rust and C++.
* Develop and maintain software architecture for real-time applications.
* Create and execute tests on both hosts and target devices.
* Assist in establishing and optimizing CI/CD pipelines.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve production and test platforms.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers.
* Review schematics and provide input on electrical designs where needed.



  





**Requirements** 



* 5+ years of experience in embedded software development.
* Proficiency in Rust, C++, and RTOS development.
* Strong understanding of embedded system architecture and design.
* Experience with CI/CD pipeline tools and test frameworks.
* Knowledge of basic electrical design and schematics (bonus).
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively across teams.



  





**About us** 





 ﻿
 
 At TERNA, innovation is at the core of everything we do. Our flagship product is an Android application assisting individual operators and machines to work more productively through 2D, to sophisticated GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) based 3D solutions elevating construction to the next level and connecting entire fleets in real time.
 



 What sets us apart is our commitment to excellence in every aspect of what we do. We’ve developed our own Inertial Measurement Units (IMUs) from scratch, handling everything from electrical design to firmware development, testing, calibration, and mechanical design in-house. Our combined software and hardware solutions offer an impressive accuracy and, unparalleled precision and reliability.

title: Senior IoT-utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Du är en lagspelare som kan samarbeta med globala tvärfunktionella team och vid behov coacha juniora utvecklare.
* Du har en lösningsorienterad inställning.
* Du levererar resultat av hög kvalitet inom givna tidsramar.
* Du har en gedigen förståelse för firmware-utveckling och de processer som används i det dagliga arbetet, samt produktintegration och testning.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Masterexamen inom Embedded Firmware-utveckling för IoT-relaterade produkter är meriterande.


 Du har minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av följande:
   

  

* Embedded-utveckling av IoT-enheter
* Utvecklingsmiljöer för inbyggda system, såsom Eclipse m.m.
* Erfarenhet av hands-on felsökning på låg nivå, inklusive logikanalysatorer, oscilloskop och produkttestning.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i C (C++ är meriterande).
* Erfarenhet av FreeRTOS/Linux är en bonus.
* Förståelse för allmänna kommunikationsprotokoll.
* Erfarenhet av Azure IoT är meriterande.
* Flytande engelska. Kinesiska och svenska är meriterande.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 17-02-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: RPA-Utvecklare
description:
*Är du en nyfiken person som älskar att analysera processer och skapa effektiva IT-lösningar? Vill du vara en del av ett dynamiskt och innovativt team som driver vår automatiseringsresa framåt? Då är rollen som RPA-utvecklare hos Länsförsäkringar AB något för dig!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som RPA-utvecklare hos Länsförsäkringar AB kommer du att spela en central roll i att driva vår automatiseringsresa framåt. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheterna för att förstå deras behov och omvandla dessa till effektiva IT-lösningar. Du blir en del av ett agilt team och kommer att vara involverad i hela processen från idé till förvaltning. Du kommer att tillhöra en etablerad grupp där du har möjlighet att påverka och bidra till vidareutveckling av våra processer och metoder för robotisering.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Analysera potentiella processer för automatisering tillsammans med beställare.
* Designa, utveckla, testa och förvalta RPA-skript.
* Arbeta nära verksamheterna för att omvandla behov till IT-lösningar.
* Vara en del av ett agilt team och bidra till förvaltning och vidareutveckling.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Relevant utbildning.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av RPA-utveckling och robotiseringsverktyg.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling inom Microsoft .NET.
* Erfarenhet av agilt utvecklingsarbete.
* Erfarenhet av kravarbete och kravanalys.


 Som person är du nyfiken, analytisk och noggrann. Du har ett stort tekniskt och digitalt intresse och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med kollegor inom olika kompetensområden. Du är kommunikativ, öppen och social, och har en god förmåga att diskutera och driva fram olika lösningar. Du är lösningsorienterad och flexibel, och har en stark vilja att utvecklas och lära dig nya saker. Du har en god processförståelse och ser snabbt möjligheter till processförbättringar. Din kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift är väl utvecklad både på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi är ett dynamiskt och innovativt team som arbetar med att utveckla och förbättra våra processer och metoder för robotisering. Vi värdesätter samarbete och att lära av varandra, och vi tror på att teamet är större än individen. Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka och bidra till förvaltning och vidareutveckling av våra processer och metoder för robotisering.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-28**

title: SAP Fiori Developer
description:
**Role: SAP Fiori Developer** 




**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Experience:** 
 10+ years
 



  





**Role Description:** 




 As an SAP Fiori Developer, you will be responsible for the design, development, testing, and support of Fiori/UI5 development objects in an S/4 HANA greenfield implementation project. You will work closely with SAP functional consultants to ensure seamless integration and enhance SAP functionality.
 



  





**Roles & Responsibilities:** 



* Design and develop Fiori applications based on functional requirements.
* Work closely with SAP functional consultants to deliver, maintain, troubleshoot, and enhance SAP functionality.
* Enhance standard Fiori apps using clean core techniques.
* Implement extensibility in SAP UI5 and Fiori adaptation projects.
* Utilize Business Application Studio (BAS) and Visual Studio (VS) Code tools for development.
* Maintain and manage UI code in Git repositories.
* Prepare technical design documents and conduct unit testing.
* Propose robust solutions to meet functional needs.
* Ensure compliance with SAP Fiori strategy, principles, and guardrails.
* Implement on-stack developer extensibility using RAP while adhering to clean core principles.
* Develop custom Fiori applications using Fiori elements templates.
* Configure and manage Fiori Launchpad.
* Build professional relationships with team members and clients for successful solution delivery.



  





**Mandatory Skills:** 



* 10+ years of experience with strong exposure to S/4 HANA implementation projects (preferably Greenfield).
* Experience in implementing Fiori apps in S/4 HANA systems.
* Strong knowledge of SAPUI5, JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, and jQuery.
* Experience with Core Data Services (CDS) views.
* Solid experience with Fiori elements and UI principles.
* Experience with Business Application Studio (BAS) and Visual Studio Code.
* Experience in Fiori Design patterns and UI Theme Designer.
* Strong understanding of released SAP APIs and best practices for custom Fiori development.
* Knowledge of FIORI - GATEWAY Services.
* Experience in tracking functional requirements.
* Good business process understanding of core processes (Finance, Procurement, and Enterprise Asset Management - EAM) in S/4 HANA.



  





**Desirable Skills:** 



* SAP Fiori application developer certification.
* Experience with RAP (Restful ABAP Programming Model) for on-stack developer extensibility.
* Experience in developing for user, functional, and system requirements.

title: People & Performance Manager
description:
**This is Worldline** 




 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 We are looking for an upbeat Tech People & Performance Manager to join our leadership team. The product domain is Digital Experience where we work closely with all customers facing digital services for Worldline. During your journey here you will get to know talented software engineering team based in Stockholm to help further strengthen empowered culture we strive to shape as well as contribute to their individual growth and performance. In this role you will work closely together with our Tech director in the Digital Experience leadership team.
 



  





 In this role as performance manager, you will be working with software engineers to create an environment where they can consistently meet and exceed the company standards while working towards their personal goals. This would also mean offering feedback, coaching and recognition for achievements and success. In this role you are not expected to contribute to the tech or product strategy as your product is the people performance itself.
 



  





**The team** 




 The Digital Experience team is like a football team that requires coaching to create the high performing players and a team to win the game. This is the role of the leadership team you will be part of where all of us are different type of coaches to provide either product strategy, direction for the game to play and players that can be motivated and focused to the goal of winning as a team.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 



* Establishing job functions and expectations
* Improving employee abilities through coaching and feedback
* Establishing employee behaviour patterns that align their goals with the organisations mission, values and goals
* Improving communication throughout the organisation
* Providing factual basis for management decisions regarding hiring
* Conducting the hiring process e2e
* Ensuring onboarding and mentorship structure is in place
* Setting performance objectives
* Ensuring everyone in the team is contributing best to its expectations



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




 People who have a professional approach, being constructive and finding solutions in the best interest of the business. You are a quick learner and self-starting, showing drive and initiatives supporting business goals. A great teammate who supports their team and puts the business objectives first. You also have:
 


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or another related field.
* Proven experience in people management
* Previous experience working as developer is seen as beneficial.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to connect with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
* Strong analytical skills to effectively process and structure large amounts of information.



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 


* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution** 




 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at
 
 jobs.worldline.com**




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Junior UX Designer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Junior UX Designer for our Design Team. Junior UX Designers at Canonical have a vital role in the success of Ubuntu, the Canonical developer experience and our Infrastructure and Enterprise products.
   

  

 There is an expectation of growth in order to deliver outstanding UX experiences and take ownership of the design of your product.
   

  

 Our design team is on a mission to turn complex, open-source software into efficient, intuitive products that can change how complex systems are built and what open source is capable of for enterprise IT. We are looking for a talented and passionate user experience designer, who shares our ambitions.
   

  

 This role sits in the design team reporting to one of the UX design managers.
   

  

 Location:
 *This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.*
**The role entails**
* Working with the open source community and Canonical customers to research new features and improvements
* Collaborating with product managers and engineers to shape the future of Canonical products
* Engaging with the design team to keep our efforts aligned with product strategy and best practices
* Working to evolve and evangelise design systems that drive consistency and efficiency
* Understanding the broader scope of your work and its numerous interconnected constraints
* Supporting one of our working groups to enable Canonical design's horizontal efforts


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Bachelor's or equivalent in User Experience, Design, or STEM or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Knowledge and passion for user experience, technology and design
* Commitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientific
* Result-oriented with a drive to finish work and celebrate success
* Confidence in user research practices
* Engagement with the latest design research and innovation
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


 UX designers should be excellent communicators who are at ease working with a complex mix of engineers, designers and executives. They represent us at cross-functional company meetings and must present their design position with clarity and precision. They should be confident and excited to take on complex design challenges. They should also be able to connect their design leadership to the strategic vision of the company.
   

  

 Read more about the design team
   

  

**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
*We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.* 
*Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration* 
*.*

title: SAP Consultant
description:
**Job Title: SAP Embedded BPC Developer** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**B2B contract** 




  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking an experienced SAP Embedded BPC Developer to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting solutions within SAP Embedded BPC, ensuring optimal system performance and functionality.
 



  





**Must Have skills:** 



* Managing the day-to-day provision of maintenance and support as subject matter expert in reporting/ report configuration with SAP and non-SAP tools.
* Development and support of all BPC objects that includes reports, input templates, master/meta data, logic scripts, business rules, BPF, work status, batch schedules
* Resolve Finance domain business issues related to SAP Finance and Controlling (FI/CO), Business Planning and Consolidation (BPC) and any deployed applications that directly support the finance domain
* Lead all projects/enhancements/changes related to SAP Finance domain
* Knowledge of architecture standard and industry best practices in SAP BPC domains
* Perform SAP BPC system configuration such as business process flow and business rules.
* Build SAP BPC model & dimension
* Perform SAP BPC system configuration such as business process flow and business rules.
* Partake in System Integration Test and User Acceptance Test script making and provide support for issue handling.
* Perform deployment of development objects throughout 3-tier landscape (Dev, QA, Production)
* Compose functional & technical design document where applicable
* Engage closely with end users, Business Process Owners and SAP BPC functional consultants for finalization of functional specifications and report formats for Business Warehouse
* Ability to troubleshoot issues relating to BPC in a timely manner
* Developing, designing, implementing and supporting business processes in an SAP environment
* Experience working on an SAP BPC Net weaver 10.0



  





**Good to Have:** 



* Well versed in usage of ABAP and script logic
* Extensive knowledge in data modelling in SAP BPC
* Experience in SAP S4HANA or ECC finance related modules is a plus
* Relevant SAP certifications are a plus
* Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in SAP Business Planning & Consolidation
* Extensive experience in Embedded BPC Latest version or earlier
* Extensive experience in SAP BW/4HANA Latest Version or earlier
* ABAP experience developing BADIs, BAPIs, Other ABAP and Front End (Excel) logic.
* To be hands on in business process reengineering, systems design, configuration and implementation of SAP BPC/ Outlook Soft solutions for a wide range of industries
* In-depth working experience with Financial Systems

title: Head of Impact & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished professional with a demonstrated track record in advancing sustainability initiatives. Your expertise lies within critical areas like renewable energy, food security, or the blue economy. Driven by a passion for positive change, you envision building a groundbreaking tech startup that disrupts the status quo and propels sustainability solutions forward.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**Ideal Candidate Profile** 



* **Domain Expertise:** 
 Possess in-depth knowledge of sustainability sectors like renewable energy, waste management, or the blue economy. You're passionate about building scalable solutions for a greener future.
* **Problem-solving Prowess:** 
 Derive satisfaction from developing innovative products that address real-world challenges.
* **Impact Driven:** 
 Fuel a burning desire to make a positive difference for both people and the planet.
* **Optional:** 
 Arrive equipped with a nascent business idea focused on a specific problem, solution, or technology.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:** 



* **Wingbits:** 
 Community-driven flight data; redefining air travel efficiency.
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture

title: Chefsassistent till fordonstillverkare
description:
**Chefsassistent/Operations Developer och Assistent till stor fordonstillverkare**
**Om tjänsten**
 Som Chefsassistent/Operations Developer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att stödja och utveckla operativa och organisatoriska initiativ som stärker företagets varumärke globalt. Du kommer att arbeta i ett dynamiskt och innovativt team som är en del av bolagets globala avdelning för Kommunikation och Hållbarhet. Tjänsten är en tidsbegränsad föräldraledighetstjänst, med start omgående och slutdatum den 31 augusti 2025. Du kommer att arbeta på bolagets huvudkontor i Södertälje.
   

  

 I din roll som Chefsassistent/Operations Developer och Assistent kommer dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter innebära:
   

  

  

* Stödja och leda utvecklingsinitiativ inom Event Experience-avdelningen.
* Kontrollera och analysera ekonomiska resultat, föreslå förbättringar och hantera budgetfrågor.
* Anpassa aktiviteter enligt företagets strategi och arbeta nära ledningsteamet för att uppnå avdelningens mål.
* Assistera chefen för Event Experience med administrativa rutiner och samordna interna kommunikationskanaler.
* Hantera och samordna möten, evenemang, resebokningar och kontorslogistik.


 Tjänsten som Chefsassistent/Operations Developer och Assistant är ett vikariat med start omgående och pågår till den 31 augusti 2025.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års erfarenhet av kommunikation, hotellverksamhet eller försäljningsledning. Du har god ledarskapsförmåga, är systematisk och har erfarenhet av att leda tvärfunktionella projekt. Du har också kommersiellt tänkande och förmåga att arbeta med finansiella verktyg.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du är positiv, välorganiserad och kan anpassa dig till förändringar. Du bör ha goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska, och erfarenhet av PowerPoint och presentationsarbete är en fördel.
   

  

 Viktigt för tjänsten är:
   

  

  

* Förmåga att analysera och föreslå förbättringar av ekonomiska resultat.
* Stark organisatorisk förmåga och erfarenhet av att hantera flera projekt samtidigt.
* Förmåga att arbeta nära seniora kollegor och vara en del av ett team.


 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Företaget leder övergången till ett hållbart transportsystem och strävar efter att erbjuda kompletta hållbara transportlösningar. Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som värderar hållbarhet, precision och engagemang och erbjuder en arbetsplats som präglas av öppenhet och utveckling.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare:
   

  

 Erik Örvell på e-post erik.orvell@adecco.se
   

  

 Har du frågor angående registrering, var god kontakta supporten via info@adecco.se
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Sökord**
 Chefsassistent/Operations Developer, Assistant, Event Experience, Södertälje, Föräldraledighet, Tidsbegränsad tjänst, Kommunikation, Ekonomisk kontroll, Administrativ support, Adecco
