title: Senior Webbutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
**Driftsättning**
 Arbeta med att driftsätta våra webapplikationer i Azure Devops och utföra patchar vid behov.
   

  

**Support Och Felsökning**
 Supporta andra team som har moduler våra webapplikationer genom att felsöka och rätta till fel som kan uppstå.
   

  

**Kodkonvertering**
 Arbeta med att konvertera legacy-kod till ny kod, vilket hjälper oss att hålla våra webapplikationer moderna och underhållsvänliga.
   

  

**Automatiserade Tester**
 Skapa och underhålla automatiserade tester med hjälp av JEST och TestCafé för att säkerställa att våra webapplikationer håller hög kvalitet.
   

  

**Modulutveckling**
 Utveckla nya moduler som förbättrar och utökar funktionaliteten i våra webapplikationer .
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 6 års erfarenhet
* Har deltagit i flera liknande uppdrag
* Kunna ta huvudansvar för tilldelade arbetsuppgifter, leda och driva uppdrag inom aktuellt område, ha hög grad av självständighet och vara en förebild för mer juniora konsulter
* Stark förmåga att felsöka och rätta till tekniska problem.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med legacy-kod i Reactjs och modernisera den.
* Kunskap i att skapa automatiserade tester med JEST och TestCafé.
* Förmåga att utveckla nya moduler och funktioner i Reactjs och Typescript
* Erfarenhet av Azure devops


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 14-02-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator
description:
Role: VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator
 



 Location
 
 :
 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



 Is it Permanent / Contract: open for both, preferably permanent.
 




 Onsite
 




   
 



**VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator:** 



* Deploy and configure VMware Cloud Director components.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with vCenter Server and NSX for networking.
* Configure resource pools, storage policies, and other infrastructure elements.
* Create and manage organizations (tenants) and assign roles and permissions to users and groups.
* Enforce security policies and manage access controls.
* Allocate and manage compute, storage, and network resources for tenants.
* Monitor resource utilization and ensure optimal performance.
* Handle resource scaling for dynamic workloads.
* Onboard new tenants and set up their virtual datacenters (vDCs).
* Provide tenants with self-service portals and catalog access.
* Handle tenant-specific configurations, such as virtual networking and VM templates.
* Apply updates and patches to VMware Cloud Director and underlying infrastructure.
* Conduct backup and disaster recovery testing.
* Leverage APIs to automate provisioning and management tasks.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with third-party tools or custom scripts for automation.
* Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory standards.



  





**Key Skills and Knowledge Areas:** 



* Virtualization: Deep understanding of VMware vSphere, including ESXi hosts and vCenter Server.
* Networking: Knowledge of VMware NSX (V or T), VLANs, VPNs, and software-defined networking (SDN).
* Storage: Experience with storage systems and VMware storage technologies like vSAN.
* Cloud Management: Familiarity with multi-tenancy and self-service concepts.
* Scripting: Skills in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or RESTful API usage.
* Security: Understanding of security principles, firewalls, and access control.



  





**Tools and Technologies:** 



* VMware Cloud Director: Primary platform for administration.
* vSphere/vCenter: Managing the underlying infrastructure.
* NSX: For networking and security.
* vRealize Suite: Includes tools like vRealize Operations and vRealize Orchestrator.
* Third-party integrations: Tools like Terraform or Ansible for infrastructure as code



 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 



  





**VMware Aria Automation Administrator:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain automation workflows using VMware Aria Automation.
* Develop self-service catalogs and automate the provisioning of virtual machines (VMs), containers, and applications.
* Create and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions using Aria and integrate with tools like Terraform, Ansible, or Puppet.
* Design, develop, and maintain vRA blueprints for provisioning and managing virtual machines and applications.
* Customize workflows using VMware Aria Orchestrator (vRO) to support complex automation and integrations.
* Implement role-based access control (RBAC) and governance policies to manage resource access in cloud environments.



  





**VMware Aria Operations:** 



* Set up and manage VMware Aria Operations to monitor the performance, health, and capacity of cloud infrastructure.
* Create custom dashboards, alerts, and reports for end-to-end visibility of multi-cloud environments.
* Conduct performance tuning, capacity planning, and resource optimization to ensure the efficiency of virtualized and cloud resources.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues in vSphere, ESXi, NSX, and other VMware products using Aria Operations insights.
* Implement alerting and integration with monitoring tools (e.g., Nagios, Zabbix).
* Automate the provisioning and management of cloud resources across private, public, and hybrid cloud environments.
* Work with cloud-native services (Kubernetes, Tanzu) and integrate VMware Aria with DevOps pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab).
* Collaborate with cloud architects and DevOps teams to align automation processes with business goals.
* Support CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, Jenkins, or GitLab.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Required Skills:



 ·        Hands-on experience with VMware Aria Automation, Aria Operations, and Aria Cost.
 



 ·        Proficiency in developing automation blueprints, workflows, and using APIs to integrate Aria with other platforms.
 



 ·        Expertise in vSphere, NSX-T, vSAN, and other VMware infrastructure components.
 



 ·        Strong understanding of cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, with experience managing multi-cloud environments.
 



 ·        Experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell, JavaScript, or Python for automation tasks.
 



 ·        Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools like Terraform and configuration management tools like Ansible.
 



 ·        Experience with VMware vRealize Automation (vRA) 7.x/8.x and vRealize Operations (vROps) 7.x/8.x.
 



 ·        Expertise in developing vRA blueprints, workflows, and infrastructure-as-code principles.
 



 ·        Strong knowledge of vSphere, ESXi, and vCenter.
 



 ·        Hands-on experience with vRO workflows, scripting (JavaScript, PowerShell, or Python), and API integration.
 



  
 


* **Preferred Skills:**



 ·        Experience with VMware NSX-T, SRM, or other VMware products.
 



 ·        Knowledge of ITIL processes and agile methodologies.
 



 ·        Certification in VMware (VCP, VCAP, or VCDX)
 



 ·        Experience with Kubernetes, Tanzu, or other container management platforms.
 



 Familiarity with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and integratin

title: Compliance Officer for Group Technology | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Group Compliance supports SEB’s business being conducted in an ethical, sustainable and compliant way for the benefit of SEB’s customers, shareholders and the society. We are now looking for a Compliance Officer to join the Compliance team for Group Staff & Support Functions, with main focus on supporting Group Technology.
   

  

 The Staff & Support Functions Compliance team was established in 2023 with the aim of further enhancing the control framework related to emerging risks such as sustainability, third party and cybersecurity and ensuring sufficient support to and focus on SEB’s Staff and Support functions themselves, including Group Technology, Group and Business Services, Sustainable Banking, Financial Crime Prevention and Group HR.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a Compliance Officer you will be responsible for compliance activities in Group Technology. You will provide expert advisory services on compliance issues and also assess and control compliance risks. You will also participate in the Strategic Initiatives New Product Approval Process which focusses on new products, systems and processes affecting SEB and/or SEB Group more broadly.
   

  

 The Compliance Officer role means daily contacts with different parts of the organisation, including members of senior management, as well as close collaboration with other colleagues within Group Compliance and, where needed, interaction with supervisory authorities.
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Compliance for Group Staff and Support functions.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* An academic degree from a university or a business school. A law degree is preferred but not a necessity if you have a thorough interest in, and knowledge of, the regulatory landscape around financial services;
* At least 5 years’ experience from working in the financial industry or related area in a capacity that has provided you with insights to relevant regulations and requirements;
* Preferably earlier worked with topics related to ICT and the upcoming EU Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA);
* An understanding of the key rules and regulations related to governance, third party arrangements and personal data processing;
* An interest in technical developments affecting the financial industry and regulatory initiatives related thereto;
* Fluency in English and Swedish.


 As a person you are positive, intellectually curious, effective and solution-oriented with good communication skills and high integrity. To be successful in this position you also need to be able to manage a working landscape with dynamically shifting priorities, timelines and demands.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible via link in this ad, but no later than February 25, 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact the Head of Compliance for Group Staff & Support functions Ahto Nirgi at +46707637785 or ahto.nirgi@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner Clara Lindström at clara.lindstrom@seb.se . We will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: E-Commerce Copywriter
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 Acne Studios is looking for an e-commerce copywriter to take on the exciting opportunity of leading the strategic and operational copywriting responsibility for acnestudios.com on a global level. The role will include establishing and maintaining copy guidelines for acnestudios.com to secure globally relevant and brand-appropriate, high performing copy. You will work closely together with the Digital Merchandising and Digital Studio teams as well as Design & Production department to write copy that delivers accurate and relevant selling points to the customer in order to maximize conversion and minimize returns.
   

  

**This position is a temporary parental leave contract.**
 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

* Responsible for establishing and maintaining copy guidelines for acnestudios.com
* Responsible for translations of an on acnestudios.com including submitting and managing copy for translations and leading developments and improvements of current practice
* Write product copy that delivers accurate and relevant selling points to the customer
* Write engaging and high converting newsletter and paid social copy
* Collaborate and contribute to the various cross-departmental activities and initiatives, including commercial campaign development, new launches, store openings, events, etc
* Work closely with Design & Production team on a product level to ensure that product copy reflects seasonal changes etc
* Actively investigate and develop best practices within e-commerce copywriting to increase traffic, conversion rate, average order value, and decrease returns


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* You seek creative solutions, challenge the status quo, and find better ways to improve processes and drive efficiency
* You take initiative, solve problems independently, and step up without waiting for direction
* You convey ideas clearly, keep information structured, and ensure smooth collaboration through effective communication
* You adapt your communication to different audiences, share information effectively, and foster collaboration
* You have a sharp eye for accuracy, meticulously reviewing information to ensure precision and consistency. You take pride in verifying facts, spotting errors, and maintaining high standards of quality in all your work


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* Minimum Bachelor's degree in business administration, marketing, fashion, or other relevant field
* 3+ years experience of e-commerce copywriting within fashion or luxury
* Understanding and knowledge of fashion and retail
* Experience of SEO copywriting for e-commerce
* Experience of product management
* Sufficient Microsoft Excel skills
* Familiarity and understanding for global and local search engines
* Fluent in English, bilingual proficiency is a plus


 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: OT Security Consultant
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About The Accelerator**
 We rapidly nurture successful businesses and services that will shape the future of assurance. The Accelerator operates a portfolio of units undergoing significant growth, chiefly through acquisitions and partnerships. The Accelerator acts as a greenhouse for a strategically selected portfolio of businesses, each of which serves different industries and markets. The portfolio benefits from dedicated support to rapidly grow through organic means, as well as through acquisitions and partnerships. Three business units were housed in the Accelerator in 2022: Cyber Security, Digital Health, and Inspection.
   

  

**About The Role**
 DNV has significant ambitions to grow the Cyber Security unit in the coming years. Building on our success and strengths in the Nordics and internationally we will make a global impact on safeguarding life, property and the environment.
   

  

 We are currently looking for talented
 **OT Security Consultants** 
 to join our growing Industrial & OT Cyber Security unit. This team provides cyber security assessments, technical verification and advisory services both onshore and offshore. You will be working on exciting customer projects in key industries including maritime, oil and gas, renewables, utilities and others.
   

  

 This role will offer you the opportunity to work alongside some of the most experienced specialists in the Industrial cyber security field. We aim to provide you with a fast-paced career that brings you opportunities to develop your competencies rapidly. We will invest in your career development, offering in-depth training and the chance to participate in industry-leading courses and projects.
   

  

**You will be based at one of our DNV offices in The Netherlands, Germany, France, Sweden and/or the United Kingdom.**
**Job Requirements**
 Broad general knowledge on OT applications and infrastructure with specific knowledge on several of the following:
   

  

* OT/IT Networks (switches, routing, firewalls)
* Must have experience working in an automation engineer background
* Firewall rules, logging, monitoring, IDS/IPS & troubleshooting (Checkpoint & Palo Alto)
* Enabling services (e.g NTP, SMTP, patching, AntiVirus)
* System integration technologies (OPC, XML, middleware)
* Server infrastructure (VMWare ESXi, storage)


**For More Information About The Position, Please Contact**
 Head of unit, Industrial and OT systems, Svante Einarsson at svante.einarsson@dnv.com
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* International working environment
* Exciting projects within critical sectors locally and internationally
* Competitive terms and conditions
* Flexible working hours and a focus on work/life balance
* Social events, sports and team building activities


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**“Power up DNV – refer from your network”**
**About You**
**What You Bring:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field
* Minimum of 4+ years’ work experience in Operational Technology Security
* Expertise on securing OT network architecture
* Experience as an Automation / Controls Engineer
* Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills; ability to clearly communicate and have excellent consulting skills
* Ability to interact with high profile clients
* GICSP, CISSP, CISM or CFSE/CFSP certification.
* Fluent language skills in English and at least one additional European language
* Willingness to travel for approx. 25% of your time


 We work with clients that are related to critical infrastructure. A qualified candidate must be able to pass a screening background check.

title: Senior Product Designer, Design System Team
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 to join our
 **Design System Team** 
 within the Central Team. The Central team focuses on providing one north star experience to all our customers at Wolt. You'll be collaborating closely with research, motion, content design, as well as the operation team. Also, with product managers and engineers to ensure that our design system supports their needs and aligns with our brand guidelines and design principles.
   

  

 This will be someone who has mastered the craft of turning insights into beautifully designed products, who can inspire organisations through prototyping and storytelling to ensure their final work has maximum impact for the customer. We hope that you have strong visual design and interaction design skills, and must be an excellent communicator in order to support designers who are using the system and to align and collaborate with them on the evolution of the system.
   

  

 📍This role can be based in our tech hub in Berlin, Helsinki or Stockholm.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
**You’re a great fit for this role if you:**
* Have experience managing design tokens, components, and assets within a design system.
* Design end to end, crafting visually delightful experiences
* Ensure high-quality, consistent, and scalable user interfaces
* Thrive in a fast-paced organisation.


**What you’ll do:**
* Listen carefully. The better you understand our users' problems the better your solutions will be. It’s important for us to know we are solving for real people and not just the loudest voice in the room.
* Collaborate across teams. You’ll partner closely with product and engineering teams to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges and ensure the design system is driving the desired user experience. You’ll provide the thought leadership to inspire and develop the right design direction. Together, you’ll solve problems and come up with solutions that delight our users.
* You work closely with engineers to ensure the efficient and effective implementation of the system and collaborate with designers to help them identify and create design solutions, new elements, and components that adhere to the system.
* Imagine the way forward. You’ll take full ownership of your work, and be responsible for every last detail, every step of the way. You monitor the usage of the system and provide feedback on how to improve it.


**Who you are:**
* Experience. You’ve been designing for 7+ years (app and desktop) for a consumer-focused tech company , so understand what it takes to create elegant, consumer-oriented experiences.
* Mastery. You are a versatile t-shaped designer who uses a full range of skills—product design, interaction design, and visual design—to ensure you deliver magical experiences to the customer.
* You’re a strong communicator. Who can inspire teams towards action and empathy for the user.
* You have a people-focused design mentality. Constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback.


**Next Steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so feel free to apply as soon as you feel like hearing more about the position and potentially joining Wolt! Please kindly make sure to include your portfolio with your application.
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platform to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores under the brand Wolt Market. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 27 countries today, 23 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

*Wolt not only offers great apps to customers and partners, but is also developing a broad range of technologies and solutions. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of minutes, in the customer’s own language.*
***So, why work at Wolt?***
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
*You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people. We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.*
*The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.*
***Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion***
*We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.*
*Join us today to build Wolt together.*

title: Operation Support Agent
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team of Operation Support Agents.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Ensuring that customers' urgent packages get to the right place, on time
* Answering incoming calls from customers in relation to shipment collection requests and delivery inquiries
* Checking and investigating failed shipments deliveries or collections when needed; prioritising and reallocating any failed deliveries for the next day delivery
* Entering data into our in-house tracking system
* Running clear and effective communication and collaboration with the team, your manager, and other operations stations
* Adhering to FedEx processes, procedures and controls, and regulatory requirements


**What Do You Bring With You**
* Good communication and social skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with strict timelines
* Ability to manage own time effectively with attention to detail


**What Do We Offer**
* Attractive compensation package
* Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
* Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
* Tuition Assistance Program (\*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
* Employee reduced-rate shipping
* Great career opportunities
* FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


 Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.
   

  

 FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
   

  

 Our Company
   

  

 FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
   

  

 Our Philosophy
   

  

 The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
   

  

 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: Gruppchef Servicedesk
description:
Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

*Är du redo för en större uppgift?*
*Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare och är organiserad i sju polisregioner, ett antal nationella avdelningar samt ett kansli. Myndigheten befinner sig i en omfattande tillväxt som kommer att pågå de närmsta åren. Detta för att kunna möta framtidens utmaningar. Att arbeta för polisen är att skapa trygghet i människors liv. Varje dag.*
 It-avdelningens främsta uppgift är att tillhandahålla it-tjänster till hela Polismyndigheten. It-avdelningen en viktig del av det brottsförebyggande och brottsbekämpande arbetet och it är ett av de viktigaste verktygen för att effektivisera polisen och öka kvaliteten i polisarbetet. It-avdelningen utvecklar och moderniserar polisens it och myndigheten satsar mycket på att stärka avdelningen med ny specialistkompetens och den senaste teknologin till nytta för medborgarna och medarbetarna i den polisiära verksamheten.
   

  

 Sektionen Servicedesk är en del av enheten It-kundservice och ger teknisk support till användare både inom och utanför Polismyndigheten och tar emot felanmälan gällande dator-, telefoni- och radioproblem dygnet runt. Sektionen består av cirka 50 medarbetare indelade i fyra grupper.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Som gruppchef för desk 4 rapporterar du till sektionschefen samt ingår i sektionens ledningsgrupp tillsammans med övriga gruppchefer, där ni tillsammans ansvarar för att uppdrag genomförs samt för att driva myndighetens förändrings- och utvecklingsarbete. Du har särskilt ansvar för gruppens verksamhet och dess resultat, inklusive arbetsmiljö- och personalansvar. Som gruppchef företräder du hela Polismyndigheten både internt och externt samt arbetar för att stärka förtroendet för polisverksamheten.
   

  

 Att vara chef och ledare inom Polismyndigheten innebär att skapa trygghet och bygga förtroende genom att utöva ett uppriktigt, modigt och lyhört ledarskap med tillit till andras kompetens och förmåga. Som chef driver du utveckling genom att inspirera och uppmuntra till reflektion och återkoppling på ett sätt som utgår från att vi följer lagen och behandlar människor lika. Du skapar förutsättningar och verkar för goda relationer som bidrar till att vi agerar tillsammans utifrån vad som är bäst för medborgarna och uppdraget som helhet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:**
* minst två års sammanhängande erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som chef med personalansvar i närtid
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med ledarskap i en större it-organisation
* ingått i ledningsgrupp eller motsvarande ledningsforum
* för funktionen relevant utbildning eller arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* erfarenhet av att ha lett förändrings- och utvecklingsarbeten
* goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
* svenskt medborgarskap


**Vi ser det som meriterande om du utöver detta även har:**
* erfarenhet av att leda andra mot uppsatta mål och resultat
* relevant erfarenhet av att leda arbete inom kundsupport
* chefs- och ledarskapsutbildning
* erfarenhet av att arbeta i enlighet med metodiken ITIL, alternativt annan erfarenhet som bedöms likvärdig


 När vi anställer kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och ledarskapsförmågor. Som grund för den bedömningen ligger Polismyndighetens ledarkriterier. Ledarkriterierna anger en beskrivning av ett önskvärt ledarskap inom Polismyndigheten och omfattar följande förmågor:
   

  

* analys och helhetssyn
* mål och resultat
* utveckling och förändring
* social säkerhet
* muntlig och skriftlig kommunikation
* skapa delaktighet och motivation


 Läs mer om ledarkriterierna https://polisen.se/ledarkriterier/ Om inte länken är klickbar kopiera och klistra in länktexten i din webbläsare.
   

  

 Som en del i urvalsprocessen kommer även tester att användas.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Vid frågor kontakta Sanna H Dahlstedt, HR-konsult, sanna.hawborn-dahlstedt@polisen.se alternativt rekryterande chef på 010 56 387 42.
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Polisförbundet, Sofia Ask, tfn: 010-563 87 10
   

  

 SACO, nås via mejl saco-s.avdelningarna@polisen.se
   

  

 SEKO Polisen, Karna Tillheden, tfn: 010-561 66 27
   

  

 ST, Tom Johnsson 076-947 00 30
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

**Anställning**
* Tillsvidareanställning med funktion som chef grupp
* Anställningen kan komma att inledas med en provanställning
* Placering Stockholm


 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. (pdf, 271 kB) Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett. Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och enkät via e-post till jobb.na@polisen.se senast den 24 februari 2025. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen. Märk din ansökan med referensnummer
 **A063.689/2025** 
 i mailets ärendemening.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en offentlig handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

***Polismyndigheten***
*Polismyndigheten erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling. Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på https://polisen.se/erbjudande*
*Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.*
**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Vi undanber oss samtal och mail från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.*
 Sök jobbet
   

  

 Ansök via e-post

title: Solution Architect - Integration & Cloud
description:
***Are you an experienced and passionate architect with a focus on Cloud and/or Integration - Find out how we can give you the future you want?***
**The Mission**
 As a Solution Architect @ Capgemini you will have a unique opportunity to help our customers design and implement the best technology solutions. Our assignments cover various sectors like telecom, retail, finance, utilities, industries, media, and public. The assignments will be on-site in the Stockholm region and you will cooperate closely with your expert colleagues in Stockholm as well as within some of the Capgemini companies globally, including State Of the Art solutions, education, and support from our partners
   

  

**The Role**
 You will be expected to shape and translate Business and IT strategy and needs into realizable, sustainable technology solutions. You will provide insight, thought leadership, and innovation to ensure that the solution meets the client’s business goals. You will ensure that the solution is designed for production and can be delivered efficiently while making sure that the solution has integrity (is safe, secure, and compliant). You will be responsible for creating technical solution descriptions (High-Level Design and Detailed Design documentation) through collaboration with the customer team and colleagues.
   

  

**Your profile**
 As a Solution Architect, we expect you to have a broad technical understanding, developer background, and strong communication skills with the ability to guide and advise our clients. You have an agile mindset; are quick to adapt to challenges and learn from new experiences.
   

  

***Skills required:***
* You have experience working as Architect, including being responsible for Solution Architecture Document (SAD) or similar
* Previous design development experience using technologies such as .Net, C#, Web API or Java, J2EE
* Experience in defining Integration Roadmaps & Architecture and/or working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP, etc.)
* Knowledge of different industry best practices in API, integration & Microservices
* Familiar with agile ways of working and DevOps
* You have a higher diploma (e.g. Bachelor or Masters degree) or equel
* You are fluent in both Swedish and English


***To stand out, you also have previous experience:***
* From the consulting industry
* Experience in Mulesoft, OpenShift, Kafka, DelBoomi, or similar solution platforms
* Certified in architecture; generic (such as TOGAF) and/or platforms (such as AWS, GCP, Azure, Mulesoft, OpenShift)
* Experience as an Architect in some of our customer's industries


***We Offer***
 A positive work environment with a strong focus on innovation and customer excellence. You will be working with many of the latest technology trends and be surrounded by skilled colleagues. At Capgemini, you will be part of a global organization with high client focus, collaborative culture, and an opportunity for continuous learning and development.
   

  

 Our Digital Architecture team in Stockholm consists of +30 colleagues who are delivering Enterprise, Business, and Solution Architecture projects to our clients, taking end-to-end responsibility to ensure that the right architecture is implemented. Capgemini has been a predominant actor in the architecture field since the ’90s, with our own Integrated Architecture Framework (IAF) and we are actively contributing to the development of TOGAF. We have a Global Architecture Community as well as local affiliates where you can leverage global and local expertise as well as contribute with your own.
   

  

**Some Other Benifits**
* Exciting career opportunities locally and internationally, and fantastic networks of expertise. With over 1500 colleagues in Sweden only, you are part of a sharp, technology and business focused community, where Coursera and more than 250 000 (!) courses and certifications are offered to all employees.
* A variety of innovative projects with well-known clients and world-leading partners – being part of a global, long-standing, successful and rapidly expanding organization.
* An inclusive corporate culture where Diversity is our most important guiding principle. We are continuously engaged in initiatives that promote diversity and women in tech; we run LGBTQ networks and aim for inclusion in all types of staff activities – from sports club to art association. Please find out more about Capgemini as an employer HERE.


 All employees are covered by a collective agreement and receive occupational pension, insurance, parental benefits and health care allowance – among other best-in-class benefits.
   

  

**In recent employee surveys, our employees particularly emphasized:**
* A friendly and flexible workplace culture
* Supportive managers and freedom of speech
* Strong values and diversity focus
* Good work-life balance


**Our Values**
* Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Konsult - Leveransansvarig IT-drift i Stockholm
description:
**Vi söker för kunds räkning en konsult / interim som Leveransansvarig inom IT-drift och Nätverk i Stockholm. Är det du? Se nedan!**
 Vi söker en konsult / interim som Leveransansvarig eller motsvarande inom IT-drift och nätverk för ett företag inom kollektivtrafik-branschen i Stockholm. Uppdraget är heltid och startar så fort möjligt och kommer pågå framåt under året.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Arbete med en bred variation av tekniska problem och system.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med modern IT-infrastruktur.
* Leda och utveckla IT-drift och nätverksleveranser i en föränderlig miljö.
* En trygg arbetsplats med ett vänligt och stöttande klimat.
* Regelbunden interaktion med och stöd från ett dedikerat IT-team.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Säkerställa att IT-leveranser inom drift och nätverk uppfyller verksamhetens behov och mål.
* Utveckling och förvaltning av IT-infrastrukturen, inklusive Cloud (Azure), On-prem-miljöer och nätverk (WAN & LAN).
* Proaktivt identifiera och driva förbättringar inom IT-drift och nätverk med fokus på effektivitet, säkerhet och skalbarhet.
* Utvärdera tekniska vägval och skapa handlingsplaner samt rekommendationer.
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av ITIL-processer (Incident, Problem, Change Management) samt licenshantering och leverantörsstyrning.
* Styra och följa upp externa partners och leverantörers aktiviteter, inklusive KPI:er eller SLA:er.
* Hantera licenser och kostnadseffektiv drift tillsammans med övriga berörda funktioner.
* Agera som Incident Manager, Problem Manager och Change Manager inom IT-drift och nätverksområdet under vissa tider.
* Aktivt informera, uppdatera och kommunicera förändringar inom IT-drift och nätverk till verksamheten och IT-organisationen.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Uppdraget har en hybrid arbetsmodell med placering på huvudkontoret cirka tre dagar i veckan där du samarbetar med interna IT-funktioner, verksamheten och externa leverantörer.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig med stark erfarenhet av IT-drift och nätverk i en liknande roll. Du har gedigen erfarenhet av Cloud-lösningar (Azure), On-prem-drift samt WAN & LAN. Erfarenhet av ITSM-processer (ITIL), licenshantering och leverantörsstyrning är en förutsättning.
   

  

 Du är analytisk, proaktiv och initiativrik. Du har en stark kommunikativ förmåga och kan förklara tekniska koncept för både teknisk och icke-teknisk personal. Du är affärsmässig, strukturerad och har förmåga att bygga starka relationer. Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift är ett krav.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Engineering Manager Payments
description:
**At Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing—making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments.** 
 We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers— improving their relationships.
   

  

 To support our growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market, we are looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 to join our team.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for an experienced Engineering Manager with solid payments experience for a team within our Payments area. This is the perfect opportunity for someone who wants to balance leadership with hands-on involvement in our client projects. You will join the team in a defining period in time with all the possibilities to find new and joint ways of working.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Manage internal and external customers
* Plan and manage product and technical deliveries, ensuring clear and timely communication
* Challenge and grow a team of developers
* Continuously improve our ways of working
* Support product discovery


**What You Bring**
* Experience creating high-performing teams
* A strong customer and commercial focus
* An understanding of how to create and measure value
* Knowledge about bank integrations and payment flows


**Who You Are**
 You have a commercial mindset with a customer focus, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment. You possess the ability to deliver scalable products rapidly and with high quality while cultivating a high-performing team. You should have a general technical understanding, even if you don’t write code yourself.
   

  

**Why work with us?**
 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
   

  

 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation.
   

  

 At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance. At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
   

  

**Welcome to the world of Billogram!**
 Since its inception in 2011, Billogram has fundamentally transformed how companies view invoicing. With an innovative, cloud-based platform, Billogram manages the entire invoice-to-cash process. It turns invoicing into an interactive, data-driven, and customer-focused experience.
   

  

 Our platform optimizes operational efficiency and increases customer lifetime value for businesses with recurring revenue. By replacing traditional PDF and paper invoices with an automated solution, Billogram reduces manual steps, lowers churn, and enhances the customer experience.
   

  

 Serving clients across Europe, Billogram combines efficiency, user-friendliness, and smart technology to help large and midsize businesses build stronger customer relationships, reduce customer service cases, and gain a competitive edge in a rapidly evolving market.

title: Legal Counsel Privacy
description:
Join Froda as our new
 **Legal Counsel** 
 where you’ll form part of our legal team and take on
 **a leading role within data privacy and security** 
 . Help us navigate the evolving regulatory landscape, support our continuing growth across Europe, and work closely with our commercial organization while driving legal projects in a fast-moving industry.
   

  

**About Froda**
 Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear mission – to democratize the access to financing and provide small businesses the same opportunities to grow as large ones. Through digital processes and technological innovation, we have shortened the loan process from months to minutes, making it easy and affordable for business owners to invest in their ideas.
   

  

 At Froda, we are making fair, fast, and accessible financing the new standard. But we’re not stopping there. Through embedded lending, we’re seamlessly integrating our technology into the world’s leading banks and fintechs, creating a future where businesses get the funding they need instantly, right where they are. Backed by cutting-edge tech and bold ambition, we’re building the next generation of lending infrastructure. Join our team and contribute to giving small businesses the opportunity to invest in their ideas to the best possible terms.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 This is an exciting opportunity to take on a leading role ensuring that Froda operates at the forefront of legal compliance and strategic risk management. In this role you’ll take ownership of the areas of data privacy and security, IT and AI. Your work will directly influence Froda's ability to expand across European markets while maintaining our commitment to compliance, efficiency, and innovation. You will report to the Head of Legal and form part of Froda’s close-knit legal team.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 Your responsibilities will change as the business develops, but these are some things we would like you to take lead on:
   

  

* Advise the business on legal matters, mainly in relation to data privacy, DORA, IT and AI regulations but also in relation to general commercial aspects.
* Work closely with Froda’s product and tech teams to identify and consult on privacy risks and improvements connected to development of new products and processes.
* Froda’s privacy compliance programme, including updating privacy and cookie policies, instructions, notices and steering documents.
* Manage negotiations of various commercial agreements.
* Take a leading role in Froda’s first line operations by implementing and improving processes to ensure Froda’s compliance with regulatory requirements (including DORA, legislation monitoring etc.)
* Support all Froda’s business units in expanding its product offering across Europe, including supporting market due diligence and proactively ensuring Froda’s product development and offering aligns with evolving regulations.


**What You'll Bring**
* Swedish LL.M (Juristexamen) or equivalent Nordic legal education.
* 3+ years of experience from a business law firm or other relevant consultancy firm, similar role within financial services, at a fintech company or relevant authority.
* Experience working with legal matters related to data privacy and security as well as corporate and commercial law.
* Strong analytical skills, multitasking ability, and fluency in Swedish and English.
* Entrepreneurial spirit, collaborative mindset, and passion for fintech.


**Who You Are**
* Thrive in a fast-paced environment, solving complex legal challenges.
* Proactive, detail-oriented, and a strategic problem-solver.
* A collaborative team player who works effectively across functions.
* Passionate about law, tech, and shaping the future of fintech.


**What’s in it for you?**
 Working at Froda means working at a company that combines the best of both worlds – fun and fast-paced culture, yet stable and structured. We are 90+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, while having fun together. You will have the ability to impact your own work and that the only thing standing between you and your goals is going to be your own ambitions.
   

  

**Furthermore, You’ll Get**
* Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
* We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan


 Be part of a growing team where your business-oriented legal expertise drives our success. Join us in shaping innovation and growth through strategic legal solutions.

title: Retail – SAP Technical Architect
description:
**Transforming Technology Experience**
 Do you enjoy working with clients and helping them to build their future success? Are you passionate about technology and the many ways it can help enterprises solve their biggest challenges? Do you want to work in the conjunction of business, technology, innovation, and change, and make incredible things happen? Great! Keep reading.
   

  

 We are looking for an SAP Retail Technical Architect to help leading Retail companies to shape their digital strategy and business transformation and help them on their journey to grow their business and stay relevant for their customers. To ensure success as an SAP Retail Technical Architect, you should have extensive knowledge and hands-on experience deploying SAP’s technology portfolio for SAP Business Suite products and even more so for the new digital core with SAP S/4HANA. This experience is required to help our clients to shape the renewal of their Enterprise-wide architecture, focusing on the core S/4 HANA setup, its direct and indirect benefits in the context of continuously evolving Retail industry context.
   

  

 To help you succeed you will have strong support of well-functioning global network of experts, who can help bringing the latest thinking and best practices to life for your clients. You get to broaden your perspectives by interacting with brilliant minds and people from many backgrounds and cultures.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
- You will have the opportunity to work for the biggest Retail clients in Europe by shaping and deploying their comprehensive future technical SAP Landscape supported by a strong functional and industry expert team.

- This is an opportunity to join the Retail client group with a focus on “thought leadership, origination, sales and delivery of large transformation SAP programs” with a strong focus on SAP Technical Architecture

- A wide range of employee benefits and career development opportunities.

**Key Responsibilities:**
- Bring Retail and SAP Integration and Architecture Expertise to large international projects, such as S/4 Implementations and conversions, technology integrations for mergers & acquisitions.

- Perform assessments of existing integration landscapes, define integration strategy

- Provide Integration delivery and operational expertise for RFP responses and present this in front of senior leadership stakeholders (C-level)

- Review and integrate all application requirements, including functional, security, integration, performance, quality and operations requirements.

- Review and integrate the technical architecture requirements. Provide input into final decisions regarding hardware, network products, system software and security.

- Plan, design and execute performance tests for SAP systems

- Performing thorough documentation of SAP Technical Configuration and rationales and presenting progress reports.

- Keeping abreast of the latest SAP offerings, updates, and developments

- Define and manage Application environments

**Requirements:**
- Experience and ideally existing relationships in retail industry

- Experience in SAP Integration landscape definition and implementation in the Retail industry

- Background in Engineering

- Experience and ideally existing relationships in Retail industry

- Advised organizations/projects on integration delivery and operational processes

- Experience with SAP Basis administration, performance engineering

- Experience as Integration/Technology Lead or Technical Architect on S/4 implementations.

- In-depth knowledge of integration architectures with SAP ERPs, including SOA, Event driven architecture

- Hands on experience with SAP Integration technologies (SAP PI/PO, CPI).

- Experience with SAP BTP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration, API Business Accelerator Hub, SAP Event Mesh).

- Worked on platform assessments, business case definitions, roadmap or IT strategy definitions.

- The candidate needs to be accustomed with sales activities. This includes a convincing, natural presence combined with the ability to confidently present in front of senior leadership stakeholders (C-Level).

- Analytical and problem-solving abilities

- Independent, and with excellent organizational and time-management skills.

- Strong inter-personal skills and the ability to influence, collaborate, partner, motivate and build relationships.

- Any SAP certification in relevant area

- Excellent communication (written and oral) skills in English and Swedish

**What we offer to you**
- Collaborate with exceptional people and work with the most interesting and challenging projects, utilizing cutting-edge technologies, and partnering with industry-leading companies.

- Health insurance, culture & sports benefits: access to several social activities through active corporate fun club

- Volunteer roles and events through our internal network.

- A variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster.

- Personal Mentor to guide your career within Accenture´s global possibilities.

- Work-life balance: good arrangements to combine family life with work and active support for mental health.

**Apply now**
 This job is based in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmo, Sweden. Apply online below. Remember to attach CV and cover letter. We look forward to receiving your application.

title: Business Analyst inom Bank och Finans med inriktining mot AML och KYC
description:
***Hej och välkommen till oss på Capgemini! Tillsammans skapar vi mervärde och omvandlar affärsbehov till högteknologiska IT-lösningar.***
**OM OSS**
 Enheten
 **Financial Services** 
 är en del av en global organisation inom Capgemini. Vilket innebär att vi arbetar med kunder i Sverige men också i andra länder i Europa. I Stockholm består vårt team av drivna kollegor med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och vi arbetar alla med de största bank- och försäkringsbolagen. Du erbjudas möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult både i lokala kundleveranser och i större globala åtaganden.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Som
 **Business Analyst** 
 arbetar du i uppdrag hos våra kunder inom bank- och finans, till dessa hör till exempel flertalet storbanker. I våra tvärfunktionella konsultteam blir du som betrodd rådgivare länken mellan kunden och utvecklingsteamet för att säkerställa en framgångsrik implementering av AML- och KYC-lösningar. Du kommer att driva processer, kartlägga affärsbehov, formulera och definiera tekniska- samt affärskrav
   

  

**I Rollen Hos Oss Får Du**
* Analysera system och processer relaterade till Financial Crime Prevention, Anti-Financial Crime och KYC compliance.
* Utgå från ett rådgivande förhållningssätt kopplat till penningtvättsregelverken och AML-riskbedömning.
* Utveckla projekt- och leveransplaner för implementeringsarbetet av teknologilösningar skräddarsydda för att möta de AML- och KYC-utmaningar som kunderna står inför.
* Tillhandahålla utbildning och stöd till slutanvändare.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om teknologier, industritrender och regulatoriska förändringar som påverkar AML- och KYC-praxis.


**DIN PROFIL**
* Minst 4–5 års erfarenhet som Business Analyst/Kravanalytiker med affärsförståelse inom finansbranschen.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba som konsult.
* Erfarenhet inom konsekvensanalys samt av att omvandla affärsbehov till affärskrav.
* Erfarenhet från Financial Crime Prevention, Anti-Financial Crime och KYC.
* Erfarenhet av programvaruplattformar som t.ex. Nice Actimize, LexisNexis, Accuity, DowJones, Netreveal, Pega eller Salesforce.
* Certifieringar inom AML är önskvärda.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, då vi har en nära dialog med våra kunder.


**VAD VI TROR KOMMER FÅ DIG ATT TRIVAS**
 För oss är delaktighet och gemenskapen viktig och vi ses så ofta vi kan för gemensamma aktiviteter som lunchträffar, afterworks och kompetensutbyte. Vi hjälper dig med kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, certifieringar och intressanta kunduppdrag för en gedigen karriärutveckling. Samtidigt som vi har en nära dialog kring hur livspusslet bäst ska gå ihop.
   

  

**ANSÖKAN**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan till oss! Vi inleder våra processer med att prata om vad du är intresserad av att göra som nästa steg och vi är genuint nyfikna över vilka faktorer som får dig att trivas på jobbet.

title: Verksamhetssamordnare till It och arkitekturavdelningen
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som bidrar till att utveckla välfärden. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner. Vår vision är världens mest innovativa och omtänksamma välfärd.
   

  

 För att kunna upprätthålla hög kvalitet inom hälsa, vård och omsorg måste välfärden utvecklas, med oförändrade eller minskade resurser. Genom digitalisering – att förändra strukturer, beteenden och arbetssätt med stöd av digital teknik – kan flera av välfärdens utmaningar mötas. Det gör Ineras uppdrag viktigare än någonsin.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som verksamhetssamordnare på It och arkitekturavdelningen har du en central och självständig roll med ansvar för att samordna och koordinera verksamhetens planering, processer och uppföljning. Du arbetar nära avdelningschefen och ledningsgruppen för att säkerställa en effektiv och strategisk styrning av avdelningens arbete.
   

  

 Din insats bidrar till att skapa tydlighet, struktur och framdrift inom avdelningen, och du kommer att ha en bred roll där du hanterar både operativa och strategiska frågor.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Koordinera verksamhetsplanering, uppföljning och resursplanering enligt Ineras årshjul.
* Samordna framtagning av mål, nyckeltal och strategiska initiativ.
* Följa upp leveranser och aktiviteter inom avdelningen.
* Stödja avdelningen i resurs- och kapacitetsplanering, inklusive uppföljning av konsulter och interna resurser.
* Identifiera förbättringsområden och utveckla arbetssätt inom avdelningens styrning och koordinering.
* Implementera och följa upp användningen av gemensamma processer och verktyg för verksamhetsstyrning.
* Analysera ekonomiska prognoser och utfall samt identifiera eventuella effektiviseringsåtgärder.
* Stödja riskanalyser och proaktivt arbeta med att identifiera och hantera risker inom avdelningen.
* Samordna avdelningens kommunikation och rapportering till Ineras ledning.
* Säkerställa att underlag och beslutsdokument tas fram och kvalitetssäkras inför ledningsgruppsmöten och andra strategiska forum.
* Genomföra analyser och utredningar samt bistå ledningen med beslutsunderlag.


**Är det här du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara strukturerad, analytisk och lösningsorienterad. Du behöver ha en god förmåga att samverka, koordinera och driva processer framåt.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Högskoleutbildning inom relevant område.
* Erfarenhet av verksamhetsstyrning, planering och uppföljning i en komplex organisation.
* Förmåga att analysera och ta fram beslutsunderlag, inklusive ekonomiska och strategiska analyser.
* Erfarenhet av kapacitets- och resursplanering.
* Erfarenhet av process- och verksamhetsutveckling, gärna med koppling till IT och digitalisering.


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete inom offentlig sektor.
* Kunskap om digitalisering och IT-styrning.


**Varaktighet och tillträde**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstidens slut.
   

  

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**
 Per Brogevik, CIO - per.brogevik@inera.se
   

  

 Fackliga frågor (Vision), Monica Rosén - 072-724 32 81

title: Account Executive, LE/GE, GTS
description:
**About Gartner**
 Are you looking for a fast-paced career with outstanding advancement potential at a global market leader? If so, think about Gartner. The world's leading research and advisory company, Gartner (NYSE:IT) delivers the technology-related insight necessary for our clients to make the right business decisions, every day. We are seeking highly motivated, achievement-driven sales associates to contribute to our double-digit growth, backed by the solid infrastructure of a world-class sales organization. In addition to a competitive base salary, uncapped commissions and exceptional benefits, Gartner sales associates can enjoy generous performance-based rewards, including all expenses paid trips to exotic locations around the world. Come be a part of our incredible growth organization!
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The Account Executive is a field-based, direct sales role responsible for both client retention as well as growth through contract expansion and the introduction of new products and services. You will consult with C-level executives to develop and implement an effective, enterprise-wide strategy that maximizes the value delivered by Gartner’s products and services.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Account management with an outcome of increased customer satisfaction and an increase in retention and account growth
* Quota responsibility of $800,000+ of contract value within a territory of major client accounts in public sector
* Mastery and consistent execution of Gartner’s sales methodology
* Account planning and territory management
* Managing forecast accuracy on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis
* Maintaining competitive knowledge and focus
* In-depth knowledge of Gartner’s products and services


**Requirements**
* 6-10 years of experience with proven consultative sales, preferably in high technology (services, software, or consultative environment), with evidence of prior success in Sales
* Strong demonstration of intellect, drive, executive presence and sales acumen
* Proven experience building excellent client relationships at C-level within large enterprise organisations
* Strong computer proficiency and presentation skills
* Professional level of Swedish
* Knowledge of the full life cycle of the sales process
* Bachelors or Masters degree – desired


**What Gartner Gives You**
* Uncapped earnings and challenging, but achievable quotas – 85% of our salesforce hit quota and 40-50% secure maximum accelerators every year
* Annual top achievers club in locations such as Miami, Sydney and Monte Carlo
* Unbeatable training and growth opportunities, including an intensive 3-week sales academy for new hires
* Excellent corporate benefits
* The opportunity to sell at C-level and work with some of the brightest minds in the industry


 Your application and the data therein are received and processed by Gartner UK Ltd., which is operating as shared HR service provider for the EMEA entities of the Gartner group. Your application will be shared by Gartner UK Ltd. with those persons within the Gartner group which decide about the steps of your application.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work .
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com .
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:97699
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Experienced Sustainability Reporting Specialist – Manager or Senior Manager – at Assurance
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  




**Job Description**

 Over the last couple of years Deloitte’s services within financial and sustainability reporting experienced significant growth and we continue to see even stronger demand for our services going forward, including assurance of sustainability reports and expectations to understand the connection between how sustainability and climate-related issues affect the "traditional" financial reporting.
   

  





 We are looking for
 **managers and senior managers** 
 for our sustainability reporting advisory and assurance team with a clear focus on:
   

  




* Develop cutting-edge competencies in sustainability reporting and assurance of sustainability reports
* Actively participate in the development of our service offering together with the Deloitte A&A sustainability reporting management team
* Deliver first class services on sustainability reporting to our clients


 Regardless of your position, you will have a central role in developing our sustainability reporting services. You will work closely with Deloitte teams across all the Deloitte functions. In your role, regardless of your level of experience, you are expected to actively contribute to driving the development of our sustainability assurance service offering. Therefore, it is valuable to have an interest in building networks with employees from other functions within Deloitte. The role also includes supporting and/or managing teams in providing assurance on sustainability reporting, but later on the role can become more or less focused on assurance depending on your preferences.
   

  


 The assignments vary in scope in everything from shorter investigative assignments to longer and more coherent projects. We work both with advisory clients as well as perform assurance assignments for our audit clients. The portfolio varies from some of Sweden's largest companies such as AB Volvo and Ericsson to fast-growing smaller companies, for example on their journey to the Stock Exchange, as well as private companies falling in the scope of the CSRD.
   

  





 A natural part of the role is participating in delivering trainings for both clients and Deloitte's employees and development of the department's structural capital (marketing material, newsletters and the like). The role may involve shorter trips, usually to Malmö and /or Gothenburg, but the scope of travel can be limited if necessary.
   

  




**Qualifications**

 To be successful in this role you should be able to demonstrate the following:
   

  




* At least 5 years of experience working with sustainability reporting or accounting and external financial reporting or as an auditor from an audit firm or other company
* Interest in deepening your knowledge in sustainability reporting and especially ESRS
* Experience of auditing is a merit as you will support and work in teams providing assurance on sustainability reporting
