title: Product Manager - Marine Transmission
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**What you will do**
--------------------


This role is both being product manager for marine transmissions and mechanical design engineer of the departments products such as marine and industrial transmissions and marine drives.

  

As the Product Manager, you will lead the development of sustainable, innovative solutions for future products, taking ownership of marine transmissions. Your responsibilities will include setting the strategy for the segment and collaborating with Product Planning to form a comprehensive product roadmap. Additionally, you will serve as the primary point of contact for customers, ensuring that high-quality products are delivered from our global production facilities.

  

You will also lead a team of highly skilled designers and work closely with production engineers, suppliers, purchasing, and aftermarket departments. You will oversee the entire product lifecycle, from conceptualization to final delivery.

  

As a Design Engineer, you will work with cutting-edge technologies through all stages of design for marine propulsion systems. We are looking for someone who is driven, curious, and eager to explore new possibilities while maintaining a strong focus on both the big picture and the details.

 **Your Future Team**


The driveline department, within Product Development, is responsible for designing and developing propulsion systems for both marine and industrial applications. Our offices are located in Gothenburg and Köping, with manufacturing sites in Sweden and the US. The team consists of 32 professionals working across various roles, with a holistic approach to product development, from new projects to product maintenance, quality improvements, and market feedback.

**Who are you?**
----------------


We are seeking a team member with extensive experience in product development and project management, who shares our enthusiasm for marine driveline products. You should be passionate about leading a team, inspiring colleagues to reach their full potential, and achieving organizational goals.

  

In this role, you will be responsible for leading the technical development of new products across all phases, ensuring timely delivery and production. You will manage the development budget and product cost while working closely with departments like product planning, supply chain, aftermarket, and purchasing.

  

You should be proficient in CAD software, particularly Creo, and have experience designing complex systems and components from concept through to production release (3D and 2D drawings). Familiarity with Volvo systems is a plus.

  

You possess the drive to develop both personally and professionally, with an interest in taking on new responsibilities. Your collaborative nature and strong interpersonal and networking skills will be essential as you interact with various internal and external stakeholders.

  

An interest or background in marine products and conditions is a bonus!

**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------


Working alongside a team of highly skilled colleagues, you will have the opportunity to grow both professionally and personally. You will not only be involved in the design and development of transmission parts and systems, but also participate in building prototypes, conducting rig and boat testing, and working closely with production teams to optimize components.

  

This position also offers the chance to network with suppliers and other departments such as purchasing, production, testing, and design. The combination of product management and design engineering will provide a dynamic and engaging work environment where you can contribute to both the strategic and technical aspects of product development.

  

Join us for a rewarding career that blends leadership, design, and innovation in the exciting world of marine propulsion systems!

 **Ready for the next move?**


If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact me!

  

Henrik Eldh, Director Driveline, henrik.eldh@volvo.com

  

Last application date: March 2

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Volvo Penta**, a world-leading supplier of engines and complete drive systems for marine and industrial applications, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who works with passion, trust each other and embraces change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Maintenance Engineer - Martin and Servera
description:
Job Introduction

We are looking for a Maintenance Engineer to join our residential maintenance team at the Martin and Servera site in Norrköping.


The TGW solution comprises a shuttle system with more than 35,000 storage locations in two temperature zones (ambient and chilled temperature). In order to utilise the available surface to its full extent, totes are stored triple-deep. An automatic mini-load warehouse with 11,000 storage locations and Mustang E+ storage and retrieval machines is used for replenishment. The site is monitored and maintained by 3 Maintenance Engineers and a Team Lead who work in a shift pattern from Monday to Friday.

* 05:00 – 14:00
* 11:00 – 20:00
* 14:00 – 23:00


The Maintenance Engineer supports our customer on all automation-related topics according to the agreed scope of supply. They provide a broad-based electrical, mechanical, controls, and software technical ability along with a right first-time mentality and a proactive approach to identifying ways to improve the site’s performance, i.e. fulfilling the contractual SLA.


Main Responsibilities
* Execute scheduled Preventive Maintenance tasks
* Resolve breakdown situations (Corrective Maintenance) - with support on more technical elements
* Ensure high levels of housekeeping, never compromise on safety first
* Support the automation to operate at its maximum efficiency
* Complete all necessary reports, including those for shift maintenance tasks, spare parts usage, and top loss, while working in DART and CMMS software platforms
* Continually improve the performance of the equipment through avenues such as top loss activities and design modifications
* Actively seek root cause when remedying any breakdowns on TGW-supplied equipment and software
* Supporting flow control activities

  


About You
* You have an Engineering Qualification
* You have some years of experience working in an automated environment
* You have an understanding of maintenance processes
* You are customer-focused
* You can work in a time-critical environment
* You are not afraid to work at heights
* You are available to work flexible shift patterns
* You are already living in the Norrköping/Linköping area
* You have an excellent command of the Swedish language


We Offer
* Permanent Contract with a competitive salary and paid overtime
* Life Assurance: 4 x Yearly Salary
* The employee is entitled to pension and social insurance benefits (sick pay and parental pay) in accordance with Swedish law and the Collective Agreement, Tekniktjänsteavtalet.
* Employee Assistance Programme
* The amount of annual vacation is 25 working days and the Employee is entitled to a vacation pay of 0,8% of the monthly gross salary per vacation day.
* Health care allowance and a free annual health check
company_description: We are an internationally leading provider of intralogistics solutions.

title: Paid Social Media Specialist (Part-Time, 50%)
description:
Are you passionate about crafting engaging campaigns, analyzing data, and driving creative strategies? Join Jobylon as our Social Media Specialist and become a vital part of our mission to revolutionize hiring!
  
  

What You’ll Be Doing
  
  

As our Social Media Specialist, you will play a key role in helping our customers grow their employer brands through creative and data-driven campaigns. You’ll:
  
  

Create, manage, and optimize campaigns across Meta, Snapchat, TikTok and LinkedIn Ads Manager.
  
Write engaging copy for ads and campaigns to attract top talent for our clients.
  
Design branded visuals with graphic design tools.
  
Analyze performance data, conduct A/B tests, and optimize campaigns for better results.
  
Collaborate with our team to brainstorm and implement creative solutions for client growth.
  
  

This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a dynamic, creative environment and enjoys the balance of analytical thinking and artistic expression.
  
  

Wagner Barretto
  
Lead Engineer
  
"As an engineer, you get the chance to work close to the business and participate in project decisions. This makes our work feel more impactful on the business and our customers."
  
Martin Linder
  
VP Sales & Marketing
  
"We are on an incredible journey and we have just started scratching the tip of the iceberg in terms of growth. If you want to be a part of building a function, this is really the place for you."
  
Elina Bergström
  
VP Customer Success
  
"Everyone working at Jobylon is amazing and super different, but we complement each other in a really good way. Our Happiness culture, as we call it, might sound cheesy, but we do it genuinely."
  
Emelie Strandberg
  
Team Lead Customer Success
  
"What I love most is that I get to grow together with an inspiring team which I'm gladly also calling my friends!"
  
  

While we value personality and potential above all, we’re looking for someone with:
  
  

Fluency in English and Swedish, both written and spoken.
  
Education in digital marketing or a related field.
  
Hands-on experience with Meta and LinkedIn Ads Manager.
  
Strong skills in writing compelling and engaging copy.
  
Proficiency in graphic design for creating branded content.
  
Skillful and passionate about analyzing, testing, and optimizing campaigns to drive results.
  
Ambition to help us and our clients grow exponentially.
  
A preference for working on-site in our Stockholm office.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
  

Be part of a company with a clear mission to simplify and enhance the hiring process.
  
Work in a collaborative, innovative, and supportive environment.
  
Grow your skills and career with a team that values creativity, curiosity, and impact.
  
  

A People First culture!
  
  

Be part of building and scaling a company
  
  

J-cation - yearly trip with the whole team
  
  

Amazing benefits and perks
  
  

International career possibilities
  
  

Work with inspiring and recognisable brands
  
  

At Jobylon, we believe that technology should simplify people’s lives. We’re on a mission to make hiring a beautiful, engaging, and enjoyable process for everyone involved. Since our founding in 2011, we’ve worked tirelessly to innovate in the HR tech space and have been recognized as one of Sweden’s hottest entrepreneurs.
  
  

Jobylon offers a modern hiring software (SaaS) to companies who want to create and share beautiful job ads and manage their applicants with ease. We work with nearly 1,000 employers from over 80 countries, including amazing organizations such as Varner, Capgemini, Skanska, McDonald’s, and more!
  
  

Our culture is built on a People First mindset, where we empower every team member to make an impact. We’re a remote-first workplace but love collaborating in person when we can.
  
  

Passion for People
  
Cultivating a humanized workplace on trust, empathy, and transparency is key for us and something that is permeating our entire culture. We believe that the key to a real success lies in people feeling safe enough to be their full selves at work.
  
  

Passion for Product
  
Creating a seamless experience for our users starts with unlocking the creativity within! We lead with a curious mind and dare to ask questions, make our voices heard, challenge each other and our product in order to bring the latest technology to the market.
  
  

Passion for Business
  
Enthusiasm and grit are the driving force behind everything we do! This translates into daring to set and meet ambitious goals, walk the extra mile, and always strive for better. We bring out the best in each other by continually challenging one another and do not settle for average.
  
  

Albin Mannberg | Contact Person

title: Senior Engineer, Cyber Defense Center
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Job Summary**
---------------


As a Senior Security Engineer in our Cyber Defense Center (CDC), you will focus your expertise on improving threat intelligence, detection, and automation capabilities to strengthen our defenses against cyberattacks targeting Volvo Group.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* **Threat Detection Engineering:** Develop and implement detection logic and rules to identify threats targeting Volvo Group.
* **Automation:** Automate our operational response activities and contribute to CI/CD, embracing a "detection- and automation-as-code" philosophy
* **Threat Intelligence:** Analyze and apply threat intelligence to inform operational workflows and guide security decision-making.
* **Security Validation:** Planning and execution of breach attack simulations to assess and improve our detection and response capabilities
* **Security Technology Expert:** Provide expert guidance on security tool configuration, optimization, and integration (XDR, EDR, NDR, network security, IDM, email security). Evaluate and recommend new security technologies.
* **Data Platform Architecture:** Design and maintain a hybrid data ecosystem (SQL, NoSQL, Graph) to support threat detection and investigations. Optimize data ingestion and processing for efficiency.
**Required Skills & Qualifications:**
-------------------------------------

* 5+ years of IT security experience.
* Experience with threat detection and incident response.
* Experience building detection logic using Splunk.
* Experience in threat intelligence analysis.
* Proficiency in programming/scripting (e.g., PowerShell, Python, Bash, JavaScript).
* Proficiency in query languages (Splunk SPL, KQL, SQL).
* Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL, and Graph databases.
* Hands-on experience with security tools (XDR, EDR, NDR, IDM, email security).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication skills

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

  

* Background in Security Operations Center, Software Development, and/or Software Architecture
* Familiarity with DevSecOps and CI/CD
* Understanding of OT security principles
**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------

* We offer a solid package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy:
* A company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion
* A new organization with highly skilled professionals from diverse backgrounds
* Colleagues with innovative mindset, always ready to support and share information
* A supportive Manager enabling your professional growth
* Opportunities to develop, build a career and work globally or cross-functionally

 **Ready to join the team?**

  

We are looking forward to receiving your application! We will interview suitable candidates during the application period.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.

title: System Simulation Engineer
description:
**System Simulation Engineer Electromobility**
==============================================

  

Design it, build it, and test it! See your design come to life and be part of the electromobility revolution! At Volvo Group Trucks Technology Electromobility, we are currently looking for a senior Simulation and Analysis Engineer to be part of a team working with system simulation & digital twins of electric driveline & Volvo Group Electromobility products.

 **What do we do?**


We are a System Simulation team in Electromobility, a dynamic team in the forefront of digital transformation working with data, simulations & digital twins to provide world-class solutions for electromobility systems and delivering customer values for Volvo business units. Electromobility is one of the fast-growing and main development areas within Volvo Group, which is at the forefront of sustainable transport solutions for tomorrow.

 **What will you do?**


You along with the team will be responsible for the system simulation platform & model development for battery electric vehicles. The system simulations are carried out within MATLAB/Simulink and are used throughout the life cycle of a Volvo product, from the concept design phase to sales, aftermarket & maintenance. The simulation platform consists of both component and plant modeling to control and software in loop.

  

You will in addition perform various simulation tasks, where we are expected to deliver & support too many ongoing projects and initiatives, structured reporting, analysis & conclusions of the simulation results are part of your role.  

In addition, the team is working with model development for physical test rigs & towards HIL rigs. Furthermore, you will work to strengthen our virtual portfolio with digital twins where we combine system simulation models with data & machine learning to ultimately enable digital services for our customers and stakeholders.  

We as a team will not solve all of this by ourselves, hence you will have close cross-functional collaboration with colleagues from different parts of Electromobility and the Volvo Group.

 **Who are you?**


We believe that to be successful in the position, you are a team player with a collaborative mindset, and you have strong experience in the simulation domain from previous positions. You have automotive or electrical system development experience working in cross-functional teams. You have a willingness to learn and take more responsibility with a can-do attitude.

 **What you bring**

* Master of Science in engineering or equivalent
* 3+ years' experience in automotive system simulation or equivalent
* Experience in data-driven model development
* Proficiency in MATLAB/Simulink and Python
* Good communication skills in English, both spoken and written

  

We are looking for a candidate with experience in automotive system simulation, which is highly desirable for this role. Experience in electromobility, particularly with batteries, would be an asset, as well as a background in software development. These qualifications are not mandatory but would enhance your fit for the position.

 **Apply now!**  

We are looking forward to receiving your application! Please don’t hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions or want to know more about this role, Hiring manager Fernanda Cabral fernanda.cabral@volvo.com.  

If you are passionate about promoting collaboration and understanding in the workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive and supportive environment, we would love to hear from you!  

Volvo Group is an equal-opportunity employer and welcomes applications from individuals of all backgrounds. We thank all applicants for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Legal Counsel Automation & Digital
description:
*At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day.*

*And we need people like you to make it happen.*


***We empower you to reach your potential with opportunities to make an impact to be proud of – for food, people and the planet.***

  


**Job Summary**
---------------



The world is rapidly changing, and leading food and beverage producers are adopting automation and digitalization technologies that give them a competitive edge, allowing them to produce more efficiently and providing insightful information for decision making. Do you want to work with a company which uses cutting-edge digital tools and innovations - connected machines, data analytics, mobility apps, virtual training and remote support – to bring value to our customers? Then Tetra Pak might be something for you.

  


An exciting opportunity has arisen for a talented IT/Tech lawyer to join our Legal Affairs team, guiding and supporting development, sourcing and sales activities across Tetra Pak’s businesses. The Legal Affairs function is headed up by the Tetra Pak Group General Counsel who leads a global team of world class lawyers, patent and trademark attorneys and corporate governance and risk management professionals.

  


The position will be based in Lund (Sweden) or Modena (Italy), and will report to the Chief Counsel, Legal Affairs, Automation & Digital.


**What you will do**
--------------------


* Advise on the development and deployment of new tech and digital offerings
* Draft, review, negotiate and advise stakeholders across the entire range of development, supply and sales contracts (software licensing, SaaS, software development, IT/Tech etc.) as well as on their interaction with other regulatory areas such as competition laws, export control and data protection
* Keep track of existing and emerging regulations and laws in the automation and digital space, such as cybersecurity, data protection, data and AI.
* Keep track of emerging trends, technologies and industry practices in the automation and digital space.
* Provide general legal, governance, risk and strategic support
* Develop and support the continuous improvement of related policies, processes (including risk assessment), template agreements, notices, checklists and other tools
* Train and develop business and legal colleagues in legal and governance areas
* Help to manage external legal advisers
* Facilitate close teamwork with the Automation & Digital team and other members of the Legal Affairs team as well as with specialists in various technology areas and other internal stakeholders.
**We believe you have**
-----------------------


* You are a highly skilled IT/Tech lawyer with a law degree from a reputable university
* You have minimum of 5 years’ experience working for a leading law firm and/or in-house in a multinational business of comparable size.
* You have experience in drafting and negotiation of tech transactions and licences (including software licenses) and knowledge of cybersecurity, data and AI is a prerequisite.
* Experience in keeping track of existing and emerging cybersecurity, data protection, data and AI regulations and laws in the automation and digital space would be an advantage.
* You are fluent in English, both written and spoken, with excellent drafting and communication skills.

  




As a person you are a driven, resourceful and quick self-starter with the ability to prioritize and manage senior stakeholder expectations. You are a strategic thinker who can apply their intellect and creativity in providing sound risk assessments and innovative legal solutions. You are practical, persuasive and a team-player with the ability to collaborate at all levels and across divisions, geographies and cultures.


**We Offer You**


* A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
* A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
* An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
* Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

  




**Apply Now**


If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.


This job posting expires on **2025-02-17.**


For questions about your application and the position contact Sara Johannesson sara.johannesson@tetrapak.com  

To know more about the position contact Markus Bonair at markus.bonair@tetrapak.com


For trade union information contact Unionen Lisbeth Larsson at +46 46 36 2320 and Sveriges Ingenjörer Lars Haraldsson at +46 46 36 2533

  


*Diversity, equity, and inclusion is an everyday part of how we work. We give people a place to belong and support to thrive, an environment where everyone can be comfortable being themselves and has equal opportunities to grow and succeed. We embrace difference, celebrate people for who they are, and for the diversity they bring that helps us better understand and connect with our customers and communities worldwide.*
company_description: At Tetra Pak we like a good challenge, and our promise is to make food safe and available everywhere.

title: AI-Engineer
description:
AI-Engineer
 




  






 As an AI engineer at Hybridity you will be at the core of Hybridity’s operation. You will be part of the team that develops the AI-infrastructure that powers our groundbreaking products. The AI team operates widely across many different areas, allowing you to be flexible in your role.
 




  






 A key component in the work is to know how to tackle problems using software development techniques. This includes setting up agentic networks, parsing data, and creating algorithms. But this can also include setting up new AI-models and pipelines to access those. We also deploy our pipelines, manage traffic, and make sure they are reliable for the incoming traffic. 
 




  






 As the field of generative AI is rapidly improving and techniques to handle the models and data are constantly being innovated upon, we also spend a lot of time researching. This allows us to have access to the latest scientific developments and requires us to always be at the forefront of this rapidly evolving field.
 




  






 An other part is to understand the needs of our clients and understand how issues within their domain should be addressed. We are pushing the frontier of how AI should be implemented responsibly into professionals' workflows. This requires a deep understanding of the daily issues of our clients and how we can use the newfound capabilities of Generative AI to bring the most value to them. 
 




  






 Join us as we solve some of the most difficult problems when applying Generative AI to complex enterprise workflows.
 




  





  





**Requirements:** 




  






 Python Experience
 





 Experience using or training AI-models
 





 Experience with Version Control
 




  





**Additional** 





 Experience in additional Object-oriented Programming Language
 





 Cloud Experience
 




  





  





**Company Overview:** 




  






 Hybridity is on a mission to free smart people from mundane work. Our niche market is regulatory compliance - an extremely target rich environment in which to apply the revolutionary capabilities of LLM.
 




  





**Location** 

 : Stockholm, in-office, remote work can be considered for exceptional candidates.

title: Frontend Engineer - Open banking
description:
**Company Description**
 Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  

 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for a Frontend Engineer to join our Customer Experience Team at Tink - part of Visa Open Banking. The Customer Experience team has a clear mission: to deliver world-class product experiences to its customers. We provide powerful solutions to developers and their consumers. By solving the right problem, crafting a scalable solution, and providing great experiences, we make the Tink platform easy to use, quick to onboard, and we ensure reliable outcomes for the end-user.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 As a Frontend Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining frontend and backend web services. You will work with your team to ensure that the end user experience of the Tink payments and account check products is reliable, scalable, and resilient. Here are some of the key tasks and responsibilities:
   

  

* Collaborating with product and delivery teams,
* Regularly deploy our work to production and assure the quality by automated tests and monitoring.
* Be responsible for the availability of the services the team owns, have SLOs/SLIs in place as well as an on-call rotation.


**The Skills You Bring:**
 We are looking for a Frontend Engineer with experience in collaborating with product teams, designers, and other stakeholders. Strong organizational and communication skills are essential, along with the ability to give and receive feedback effectively. The candidate should be self-motivated and proactive in identifying and driving opportunities for improvement.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Experience writing, releasing, maintaining web applications.
* Comfortable with HTML, CSS and Typescript.
* Experience with modern web application development in React.
* Experience with methods for managing application state, such as Xstate, Redux, Reflux, Flux or similar.
* Experience with updating and maintaining a backend service.
* Ability to recognize and implement modern product design.
* Experience from fullstack position is a plus.


**Additional Information**
*This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office as determined by leadership/site, with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.*
 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Leya, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 Are you ready to take your AI career to the next level? At Leya, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the legal industry with cutting-edge AI and LLM tech. We’re seeking an AI Engineer to join our face-moving team, where you’ll work on technically difficult projects with the support of an amazing team, and help redefine how legal professionals work.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement all AI and LLM features at Leya
* Ensure we utilize the latest and greatest LLM features, agentic tools etc
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Own and drive forward PoCs and solve broad technical challenges


 Who you are
   

  

* A passionate software engineer with a few years of experience implementing and evaluating AI and LLM applications
* A strong coder: Proficient in languages like Python, with an emphasis on clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the systems you architect
* You’re a low ego, true team player
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about applied AI


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Leya with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Leya for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Leya is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $37M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Leya is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Fullstack Engineer at Leya you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are:
   

  

* A passionate engineer with several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Leya with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Leya for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Java)
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***
**Who We Are…**
 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
   

  

 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
   

  

 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
   

  

**Your New Role...**
 The Commerce group is part of the Core & Data organisation within WBD’s Global Tech division. Our services handle all aspects of monetizing our streaming services. This includes everything from managing products, pricing, and promotions; selling subscriptions and pay-per-view events; integration with 3rd party providers for global and local payment methods; handling taxes, fraud, financial reporting, and much, much more. We provide the backend APIs that power all our clients, and our teams own design, build, maintain, and are responsible to both deploy and operate our services. The group is currently based in the US, Sweden, Poland and India. Come join our talented team of experienced Engineers, working together on solving the most rewarding challenges in an autonomous and friendly work environment!
   

  

**Your Role Accountabilities...**
* You are able to work autonomously to design and develop functional changes to existing software systems. You require little or no guidance from team members. You still actively seek input where appropriate and engage your team to inform and share what you are doing.
* You can collaborate with other engineers assisting on features another engineer designed or taking the lead on feature design yourself. Your software contributions are demonstrated to work in production, and your team trusts your decisions, designs, and code.
* You are able to describe and defend your design and code decisions to other engineers, embrace constructive feedback, and adapt your approach to align with team and company standards and objectives.
* You consistently demonstrated good software ownership practices (e.g. code reviews, code comments, etc) in all of your contributions. Your code reviews are uneventful, you prepare documentation proactively, and you ensure proper monitoring for operational excellence in production.
* You offer enhancements to best practices, document, design, and architecture improvements, and as feedback through code reviews to other engineers without continuous prompting or recurring encouragement. Other engineers appreciate your feedback.
* You can troubleshoot a production issue by reviewing source code, logs, operational metrics, stack trace, etc to pinpoint a specific problem and then resolve it.


**Qualifications And Experience...**
* Proficient in Java or other JVM languages.
* Experience and deep understanding of Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS.
* Great understanding of distributed systems challenges, micro-service-based architectures, and asynchronized communication (e.g. using gRPC and Kafka).
* Ability to implement alerting, metrics, and logging using tools like Prometheus, CloudWatch, Kibana, PagerDuty.
* Practical knowledge of persistence and caching solutions such as PostgreSQL, Redis, ElasticSearch, Caffeine.
* Familiar with asynchronous, non-blocking, functional/reactive styles of programming. Hands-on experience with frameworks such as Spring WebFlux, Vert.x, Node.js.


**How We Get Things Done…**
 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
   

  

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**
 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
   

  

 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

title: Embedded Platform Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Configure, maintain and deploy Yocto-based Linux platform including BSP, drivers, and system services.
* Integrate and optimize an open-source management platform with secure APIs.
* Establish secure communication (TLS, certificate management) over industrial protocols (CAN, MODBUS, MQTT, HTTPS etc.).
* Maintain cloud connectivity, IoT security, and OTA update mechanisms.
* Design and manage the CI/CD pipeline to streamline deployment and application integration.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Embedded Linux (Yocto, BSP, driver integration, security hardening)
* ARM-based platforms, networking
* Cloud & IoT (MQTT, TLS, secure OTA updates)
* Industrial communication protocols (CAN, MODBUS, API integration)
* CI/CD, automated build systems, developer enablement


**Application deadline:** 
 13-02-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: C# Developer | SEB, Solna
description:
Join Our Team as a Talented C# Developer! Are you passionate about finance and market data? Do you want to be a key contributor to a critical system that supports SEB’s global financial operations? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you within our Shared Platforms team.
   

  

 At SEB, technology drives our mission to deliver world-class financial services across 20 global sites. Join a team of over 2800 innovators shaping the future of finance by bridging cutting-edge technology with the dynamic world of global markets. Here, your work will directly influence financial flows, empowering us to deliver unparalleled service to our clients.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Our Shared Platforms team of six talented individuals is looking for a new colleague with C# knowledge to work on various exciting systems. You’ll have the chance to expand your skills with JAVA, C++, and .NET, which we also use.
   

  

 As a C# Developer, you will:
   

  

* Develop in-house built applications.
* Collaborate with users to understand their functional and technical needs and address challenges effectively.
* Configure, integrate, and customize our products to meet business requirements.
* Liaise with Product Owners, Scrum Masters, and colleagues to deliver high-quality solutions.
* Drive process improvements to ensure safer, more efficient deployments.
* Assist the support team on the most critical support cases, working closely to resolve complex challenges.


**What We’re Looking For**
 We believe you’ll thrive in this role if you have:
   

  

* A development background in C#. Knowledge of C++ and Java is a plus.
* Good knowledge of Windows OS and Visual Studio.
* Familiarity with Linux and MSSQL.
* Experience in a client-facing technical support role or an implementation/delivery role.
* Strong problem-solving skills to identify root causes and implement creative, pragmatic solutions.


**It’s also considered advantageous if you have:**
* Familiarity with financial systems, such as front office systems, market connectivity, or fixed income trading platforms.
* Understanding of market data providers like Bloomberg, Reuters, or Nasdaq OMX.


**What We Offer**
* Agile and Modern Ways of Working: Join a team that embraces collaboration and flexibility.
* Flat Hierarchy: Share your ideas, opinions, and perspectives in an open, inclusive environment.
* Extensive Learning Opportunities: Access specialized training programs, industry certifications, and personal development initiatives.
* Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace where everyone’s voice is valued and respected.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Do you want to be a part of SEB?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2025-03-02. If you have questions about the position, please contact Mara Muraska, Team manager, at mara.muraska@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the #1 e-scooter service in Europe, operating in 100+ cities with over 275+ MILLION rides to date. It has been an amazing journey and we have no intention of stopping now!**
**As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building, and maintaining machine learning models across key business areas. Your work will involve tackling challenges that draw on your expertise in interconnected fields such as software engineering, data engineering, data science, and machine learning. Ultimately, you will drive and contribute to solutions addressing some of our most important challenges, including maximizing availability, reliability, and safety. You will join a team uniquely positioned to ensure our users always have a scooter nearby when and where they need it. Additionally, you will play a pivotal role in anticipating and addressing vehicle maintenance needs early, which is essential for delivering an exceptional riding experience.**
****YOUR MISSION AT VOI****
* You will be an integral part of a cross-functional product team, contributing to end-to-end machine learning projects. This includes starting with a business problem, developing solution hypotheses, defining data requirements, creating prototypes, implementing solutions in production, and measuring their business impact
* Self-sufficiently drive and develop production-grade models with an emphasis on reliability and scalability. Collaborate with the product manager to prioritize solution paths, ensuring a focus on delivering the greatest business impact
* Enhance and maintain our machine learning platform, ensuring that Voi’s machine learning products adhere to state-of-the-art MLOps standards
* Influence and introduce strategic topics, including decisions on tech stack, enhancements to team workflows, and collaborative prioritization of product directions with the product manager, based on feasibility and anticipated business impact.
* Guide, coach, and collaborate with colleagues to enhance team and functional workflows, fostering a culture of mutual support, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing


**What You Need To Embark**
 We’re looking for a Machine Learning professional with experience from working in a fast-paced environment. In addition to being fluent in English, we believe the right person has:
   

  

* A higher education degree in a mathematical science such as computer science, mathematics, physics, bioinformatics, or a similar data-focused field
* A strong business sense with laser focus on business value and user impact
* Fluency in Python in particular and software engineering practices in general
* Documented experience of working with MLOps in GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure
* Documented experience in developing production-quality software
* Hands-on contribution to managing projects from start to finish – from tackling business challenges to planning, building, launching, and keeping an eye on the results


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europes #1 micromobility company
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and be a part of building a world class organisation
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Mechanical Test Engineer till Scania
description:
*Är du en passionerad testingenjör med öga för detaljer och en stark drivkraft att utveckla framtidens tunga fordon? Hos Scania, en global ledare inom kommersiella fordon känd för innovation och hållbarhet, får du möjligheten att vara med och säkerställa att våra truck chassi-komponenter möter de allra högsta kraven på säkerhet och prestanda.* 




  





 Om tjänsten
 



 Som mekanisk testingenjör ansvarar du för att utföra avancerade tester på komponenter inom truck chassi. I rollen ingår bland annat klimatscykeltester, öppna/stänga-tester samt tester för att utvärdera utmattning, funktion och systemförståelse. Du säkerställer att varje komponent lever upp till höga krav på kvalitet och säkerhet genom noggranna och systematiska tester.
 



  





**Du erbjuds** 



* **Professionell utveckling** 
 : Möjlighet att vidareutveckla dina tekniska färdigheter och bli en expert inom komponenttestning.
* **Innovativ arbetsmiljö** 
 : Arbeta i ett dynamiskt team där innovation, hållbarhet och kontinuerlig utveckling står i fokus, med chans att påverka och forma framtidens tunga fordon.
* **En dedikerad konsultchef:** 
 som följer och stöttar din resa hos Scania.



  





 Arbetsuppgifter
 



 I rollen som Mechanical Testing Engineer kommer du att:
 


* **Testa komponenter** 
 : Utföra tester såsom klimatscykeltest, öppna/stänga-tester samt tester av utmattning, funktion och systemförståelse för truck chassi.
* **Datahantering** 
 : Anskaffa mätdata och använda analyseringsprogramvara för att utvärdera testresultaten.
* **Samarbeta** 
 : Arbeta nära utvecklingsteamet för att identifiera förbättringsområden och säkerställa att våra produkter lever upp till Scanias höga standard



  





 Vi söker dig som
 


* Har en kandidatexamen eller magisterexamen inom maskinteknik eller närliggande område
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av mekanisk testning
* Starka muntliga och skriftliga kunskaper i engelska samt flytande svenska



  





**Det är meriterande om du har:** 



* Erfarenhet av FEM-analys.
* Erfarenhet av komponenttestning inom truck chassi.
* Kunskap om drivlinor (powertrain) samt allmän kunskap om tunga fordon.
* Programmeringskunskaper i Python – för att effektivisera testprocesser.
* Praktiska mekaniska färdigheter och erfarenhet av mätdata-anskaffning med tillhörande analyseringsprogramvara



  





**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:** 



* Noggrann
* Analytisk
* Kommunikativ

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Python och Go
* Vana vid att arbeta med Kubernetes och Docker
* Goda kunskaper i SQL
* Stort intresse för att arbeta med data
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila team


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av GCP, BigQuery, Airflow eller Clickhouse
* Erfarenhet av att bygga CD/CI-pipelines
* Erfarenhet av dbt


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 17-02-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: ETL Developer - FME / SQL / BI
job_function: Analyst, Information Technology, and Project Management
description:
NTT DATA is currently looking for an ETL Developer for an EU agency in Stockholm.
 



 Your role:
 


* The consultant is expected to perform the tasks related to the projects, products, applications and services developed in the DTS Digital Solutions section related to ETL developments.
* Design and develop new ETL flows for system integration, automated dataflows, data validation and storage
* Contribute to the design of the overall solution architecture, interfaces, services, infrastructure configuration, security and access policies
* Optimize performance of new and existing ETL flows.
* Testing ETL solutions and integration testing individually or in collaboration with other teams
* FME flow management of workflows, job scheduling, resource allocation, error handling, monitoring, ensuring scalability



 Your profile:
 


* University degree in computer science (or equivalent) with minimum 3 years of experience in IT, or non-university degree with minimum 6 years of experience in IT
* 3 years' experience as ETL developer/Engineer developer using FME
* 3 years' experience using SQL of which a minimum of 1 year TransactSQL
* Experience working with work item management tools (e.g. Azure DevOps, TFS or Jira)
* Experience in Data modelling
* Experience in Data warehouse architecture
* Experience in FME flow management of workflows, job scheduling, resource allocation, error handling, monitoring, ensuring scalability
* Experience in performance optimisation of ETL flows
* Knowledge of the software development lifecycle in both: waterfall and Agile/DevOps modes
* Experience working with work item management tool Azure DevOps
* Experience producing and maintaining technical documentation
* Proactive communication and collaboration skill in a multidisciplinary team
* Experience of working in an Agile environment
* Experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD and automation
* Advanced TransactSQL skills
* Experience in SSIS
* Work in a multicultural context.



 Language skills:
   

 You are fluent in English.
 



 NTT DATA - a part of NTT Group - is a trusted global innovator of IT and business services headquartered in Tokyo. We help clients transform through consulting, industry solutions, business process services, IT modernization and managed services. NTT DATA enables clients, as well as society, to move confidently into the digital future. We are committed to our clients' long-term success and combine global reach with local client attention to serve them in over 50 countries. Visit us at nttdata.com
